text: Awesome food...awesome service....and drinks will flow! Take your date or your whole family you will enjoy it  Bill (Chandler)

Great neighborhood joint! It's a place to go when you're craving good steak but don't want to pay steakhouse prices. The service is always excellent, and I don't think I've ever had a bad item on the menu.

Consistent is a great word to describe this place. The food is consistently great; the service is consistently great; the regulars are consistently there. (they're great too). It has a comfortable smoking/drinking patio and great prices during happy hour. The staff and owner is always (consistently) accommodating and friendly. You feel like you are part of the family here.   Food I'd recommend: Any fish served Greek style, the Prime Rib, the burgers and definitely the fillet medallions with the gorgonzola wine sauce. All the food is good though and you gotta love the salad bar!

I drive by here everyday and just recently noticed it. I just wish I would have found it sooner! I went for brunch on Mother's day here. I was immediately greeted at the door with a friendly smile. Then places at a table in a very nice room and coffee and drink were brought out quickly.   For brunch they had a prime rib eggs Benedict. Holy S***!!! It was amazing! The meat was so tender and cut like a firm cheese. The sauce was perfect and plentiful. The side of roasted potatoes were seasoned to perfection.

Feeney's used to be a wonderful restaurant.  However, I have not enjoyed the last 3 meals I received there.  You should get more than 4 shrimp in the shrimp scampi for the price, there is simply something wrong with the cheese on the pasta, and the I had to throw away the last steak because it was just fat.  Hopefully, things will improve in the future.

I live in the area nearby Feeney's and when I drove by tonight it smelled amazing, so I decided to stop in and get my dinner to go. I heard that that this place was the first Beefeaters restaurant in Phoenix, so I had high expectations. The restaurant was a small but quaint establishment it with a nice intimate ambiance. When I sat down bartender was extremely busy, so I was offered little guidance with the menu. The bar was somewhat crowded, and there was clearly only 1 bartender for the whole restaurant.  The prime rib was tasty, although a little fattier than I like and had very little marbling.  The mashed potatoes were good, but nothing out of the ordinary. Unfortunately, when I opened the soup it looked (and tasted) just like beef barley. Since I ordered clam chowder, I thought they obviously made a mistake, so I returned thinking it was an error. I spoke with a well dressed older gentleman, whom I presume was a manager and after I explained the mix up,  he explained that they only serve "Manhattan Style" chowder.  When I indicated that I didn't care for it at all, he simply replied that it came with my dinner, and I was not charged for the soup.  I left without further pressing the issue, however, I was truly disappointed that not even an offer was made to give me something else that I would have enjoyed. The food was OK, but avoid the clam chowder - IMHO it was not good at all. I would also suggest to management,  that if a guest cares enough to return to your establishment, regardless of the cost of the item, you should make it right.

I honestly wish I could give this place 20 stars! Places like this do still exist, and it's awesome! The place itself is almost like being back home, and seeing your loved ones. They welcomed us with open arms, and treated us like family. The food was AMAZING!!!! The owners were AWESOME!!! The wait staff was extremely attentive and made sure we had everthing we needed. Feeneys is to me, a diamond in the ruff. We cannot wait to come back for more!

I have always enjoyed going to Feeneys, for their great food, nightly specials and to enjoy drinks with friends on their patio. Now after the resent renovations, the fresh look , and atmosphere makes Feeneys my favorite place for dinning and drinks.

Amazing food and wonderful people! We were visiting from out of state, looking for a great steakhouse, and could NOT have had a better experience! We've eaten at some of the "well known" Phoenix steakhouses in the past, but will forever come back to Feeney's when given the opportunity! The flaming cheese (Saganaki) was wonderful, entrees (filet, strip steak, twice baked potatoes) were fabulous, and the dessert was AMAZING!!! A definite must do for any visit to Phoenix! Quick tip- they must've switched web hosts- to see the menu go to: feeneysaz.foursquare.com.

This place is very outdated on the decore, and the customers are kinda older too, but they are on to something! they have a great salad bar and a great menu! everyone who was working there seemed happy and helpful.  The drinks are GREAT as well! Everyone I know loves the Monday night burger special........ $4 burgers with fries so they say! I stick with the fish and chips! they are amazing!

this is a great place to go if you're looking for quality food at AFFORDABLE prices and a nice cozy atmosphere! they specialize in steaks and seafood but have other choices on the menu. i think this is a romantic place. it's small,  the lighting is low, candles on the table, and just all around intimate. this is not a large chain type of restaurant where you will be lost in the crowd and ignored.  the steaks & primerib are great. the prices are very affordable, much cheaper then anything like outback steakhouse or black angus. i get a large steak for about $15.00 and the primerib is priced under $24.  there are numerous daily fish specials to choose from which range anywhere from $9-$13. there are all sorts of fish dinners. you get an all you can eat salad bar with all meals. the appetizers are good and all appetizers are priced under $8. we always get the calamari. they do have a small bar area in the front. THE SERVICE IS ALWAYS BEYOND GOOD. THE WAIT STAFF IS VERY FRIENDLY AND THE OWNER OF THE RESTAURANT WILL ALWAYS COME BY AND GREET YOU AND MAKE SURE YOU ARE HAPPY WITH YOUR EXPERIENCE. they treat you very well and appreciate their guests. i go to this restaurant for all special occasions.  as an added benefit, THIS RESTAURANT IS ON  RESTAURANT.COM    IF YOU GO TO THIS WEBSITE, YOU WILL GET $25 OFF YOUR BILL OF $50 OR MORE. feeney's is on 12st, just south of glendale.

This is the best place in Phoenix to get some ribs! I wish I could come here every night. It is a family run restaurant that welcomes everyone. All the food is great, but the ribs in my opinion are the best thing on the menu. The service is great and it complements the fact that they are making the best food ever. So come try Fenny's in Phoenix, Arizona.

Decided to go here for dinner last week. I have driven by many times and saw the great reviews on Yelp. Our waitress who is also the owner was so welcoming and helpful.  I ordered an end-cut piece of prime rib and the salad bar. Nice selection of fresh salad items and salad. The prime rib was excellent, actually the best piece I've had since moving to Arizona in 1981. Would definitely go back again!

Yum! Where do I start...from the Saganaki (flaming cheese) appetizer, Awesome Salad Bar, Amazing Entrees...Everything is Delicious!!! Today I had the Filet Medallions over Gorgonzola cheese mashed potatoes...OMG! So yummy! And of course the staff is amazing! Love Maria, George, Judy and all!! Highly recommend it!

Very good local steakhouse. The wine was good and VERY reasonably priced. I had Prime Rib which was delicious and my husband had sirloin and shrimp. Sides were okay but save room for dessert....the cheesecake is made in house and is worth every calorie! We will be coming back...like the old school atmosphere and welcoming employees!
Thought it was a dive bar until I read the yelp reviews. Definitely not a dive bar. Phenomenal prime rib!!

Great cozy restaurant. Food is good especially the salad bar. Top sirloin was good and my husband enjoyed the prime rib. The service was not the best. We were never brought any bread and it took a long time to order another round of drinks. When my beer came, it wasn't cold. All in all, we will return.

I love this place they have the best prices for the quality of food they serve and when you go there you feel welcomed. Maria and George run the place they are great super friendly, and  you will always see them with a smile ! The best for last best prime rib in town by far keep it up guys !
The potato skins were yummy! My Feenies burger was pretty good, although I tend to like my burger a little messier. The staff there was extremely accommodating and nice
Great neighborhood bar. Took my friends there after they helped me move just around the corner from Feenys. I've enjoyed it ever since. Awesome peeps and great hospitality.
The staff was friendly but the food was terrible. Salad bar looked days old and the prime rib was the worst I have ever had.

I live within walking distance of Feeney's but I've only been there about a half-dozen times because there always seemed to be somewhere else to go for a bite or a brew. But I was in the mood for a good old-fashioned steak dinner and made a point of heading there tonight. I won't be back.  There's charm inside this building, if a little stuffy and warm on a summer evening, and there's no denying the friendliness of the staff. But friendliness and charm aren't substitutes for quality and service. On past visits, I've eaten in the little sitting area off the bar, which is more casual and under the eye of the bartender. Previous meals have been fish and chips, burgers, and appetizers, and they've been mostly suitable. I guess I don't have high expectations for potato skins and calamari, snacks that could've come from a bag in the freezer, but I was disappointed by fish and chips, an entrée that looks like it fell from a TV dinner carton. That experience kept me from returning to the dinner menu for a couple of years. No matter. I was in the mood for red meat and that is supposed to be their specialty.  I ordered the top sirloin steak medium-rare and French fries. I got a thick steak on the wrong side of medium-well and pedestrian shoestring potatoes that were cold to the touch and basically inedible. The steak tasted fine but with almost no pink inside, it was some tough chewing. Maybe the cook made the fries too soon and overcooked the steak by accident or maybe the server forgot to pick up my order and it sat on a counter, the steak continuing to cook from carryover heat while the fries cooled down. Considering how seldom I saw my server and how long it took to get my order, either explanation is plausible.  Local restaurants are fun to patronize but it's not worth it if the product is overpriced and the service is lacking. My money will go where it spends the best. It won't be spent at Feeney's any longer.

We are visiting Phoenix and wanted a good steak that didn't break the bank so we went with the good reviews and were not disappointed! Maria is a warm wonderful hostess that made us feel at home and recommended the NY sirloins which were melt in your mouth fantastic! This place is very old school (think Ponderosa) with their chilled plates for the salad bar and dinner rolls but what it lacks in modern decor is balanced by the perfectly cooked steaks and fantastic service. I even got a hug on the way out from Maria, this is exactly what the hubby & I needed so five stars for food & service.
Excellent  Amsphere, great staff, and good food! Love this place!

They really need to update their website! Went in for the HH specials and apparently no more happy hour to speak of! Also, the 10% off coupon  on the website  is no longer offered. I wish I could give their amazing bartender 4 stars while just giving the establishment 1! She is the ONLY redeeming quality they have.

Such a great place! We have lived just down the street from it for a while but finally decided to give it a try last night. The food was great the atmosphere was even better and the service was wonderful. We had our two children with us and one of the waitresses (who wasn't even our server) made a point to introduce herself and ask the kids' names; they were very welcoming. They have a great menu for both food and drinks and the salad bar was good too. We will definitely be back.

This is an amazing hidden gem in Central Phoenix. Maria and George are amazing hosts. The atmosphere is perfect and the food is outstanding. Outside seating with big screen is great for game day.   A must if you are in Phoenix

I bought a few restaurant.com gc's & Feeney's was one of them. I have never been here, let alone heard of this place, but I checked it out on Yelp & the reviews were positive so I thought why not?!   We arrived at about 8pm this past Saturday. It wasn't busy but it wasn't dead either, I would say there were about 10 other parties there maybe more. From the looks of the building & decor it seemed that Feeney's had been around for quite some time, definitely had character.   For starters we ordered the crab stuffed mushrooms & I ordered a couple cocktails (strawberry vodka w/cranberry juice-yum!). The app was pretty good but it lacked flavor. I have to say Red Lobster's version is better. For our entrees, my hubby ordered the king crab legs & I ordered the filet medalions. You can't really go wrong w/crab legs, hubby loved them! I had a bite & the meat was sweet & very fresh. I am never one to clean my plate, but I finished my entire entree! The meat was cooked perfectly (medium-rare) & the mashed potatoes/asparagus were delicious as well. I wish I had received more asparagus though, only 2 pieces were given. Oh & I almost forgot, our meals came with their famous salad bar. Our salads were pretty good but kinda boring. I thought there would be more of a wow factor there but it wasn't a disappointment or anything since I am not really a "salad person". After devouring our meals we were stuffed but I wanted dessert for later so I ordered their mud pie to go. It was pretty standard but damn it was good. Chocolate cookie crust, mocha ice cream & chocolate ganache-freakin delish!   With the $25 gc our total came to about $70 (including tip). Not cheap, especially for the area, but I have to say it was pretty good! We would definitely come back, I am curious to try their $4 burger special on Mondays.

Feeney's is the best! I have been going for years and it's always been amazing. The salad bar is always a favorite. It's always fresh and packed with great veggies. The prime rib and the prime rib sandwich are the best I've ever had. I've tried a lot of prime rib at very expensive restaurants and Feeneys is by far the best. The sandwich bun is so soft and so delicious. The meet cooked perfectly at medium rare. I can't say enough about this place, the food, the service, the owners are all amazing. It's like your neighborhood Cheers where everyone knows your name, but the food is amazing to match!

I met two friends at the restaurant who had previously eaten there.  They said it had great food and it was their neighborhood go to place.  They had always had great experiences and so did I.  I ordered the Greek Salad and my friends ordered the Shepherd Pie and the spaghetti.  We all loved the food.  The service is just the right amount of friendly.  They are attentive and seem to be available just when you need them but they do not hover over you.  The prices were in the medium range.  I would definitely go back again.

I love the local vibe of this place. It's very old school, nice old bar, low ceilings, dark lighting, etc. The food is very good, especially if you can get the prime rib. Salad bar has lots of selection. Can't go wrong. Parking can be a challenge on busy nights.

I genuinely cannot believe I haven't reviewed Feeney's. I look back at my reviews and it's like I'm emerging from a fog. A year flew by and I didn't review anything. I could have sworn I had reviewed Feeney's. So big a part has Feeney's played in my life this past year, it's like I've never NOT gone to Feeney's.   The first time I went to Feeney's was like every time I go to Feeney's. I marvel at its bald-faced lack of pretension. This is a restaurant by and for people who remember what restaurants used to be like before chains became the norm and non-chains realized they were special and started becoming overpriced poor-value destinations (cough-Durants-cough).   If you grew up in the 70s or 80s, you will instantly recognize this place. Dingy without being dirty, all dark woods and low ceilings and Irish village frescoes. At first, you will wonder how it could possibly have stayed in business while maintaining this look, because most of the places that looked like this flatly could not keep up with changing tastes and increasing demands for quality and flair. Then you eat and you realize the truth: Feeny's keeps it simple with can't-miss old-school standards and top notch preparation and quality.  It starts with the salad bar. That's right - that relic of the 70s and 80s where you are told you are welcome to go ahead and serve yourself while you wait for your dinner to be prepared. Not well stocked enough to be a meal on its own (which is as it should be), the salad bar is the perfect appetizer. What's there are all the standards for a competent salad, is fresh, delicious and even the dressings taste home made. If it starts with the salad bar, it finishes with a flourish with the entrees. Real deal steaks and seafood, prepared simply and competently. I always get the prime rib. In fact, the reason we found Feeney's was because I was in the mood for a prime rib and we went looking for one locally. I was not disappointed. Perfectly prepared with a side of au jus and creamed horseradish, if you like prime rib, you will be intimately familiar with its presentation here.   I should mention that the service has never been anything short of top-notch. Even at their busiest, we receive constant, uninvasive attention from the host, waiters and other staff.  In short, if you're looking for a homey independent throwback that has class-A food and service at reasonable prices, give Feeney's a try, you'll love it. I know we do.

probably one of my favs!  Escargot is amazing, loads of voices for small plates. The roast beef with herb cheese bruschetta is like a small sandwich of goodnessSince this is a neighborhood place for me I frequent often with my friend. Never a disappointment this STAFF is fabulous! Judy And Amanda never stop smiling and they HUSTLE to get your order in. Their prime rib and seafood is deliciously prepared!   go for happy hour but definitely stay for dinner!

I will start off by saying that I came in craving a beef Wellington & my craving was definitely fulfilled! On top of the wonderful Wellington, the service was top notch. The bus boy was one of the friendliest guys I've met, so talkative & attentive. Our server & owner, George, was great. When you check in on yelp you get free potato skins, which were yummy! But on top of that, George gave us two free glasses of wine, for what he claimed to be "a long wait". We were enjoying our time, certainly didn't think we had been waiting long for our food at all. And finally, because it was our first time there, he brought us a delicious mud pie. Seriously... We needed them to wheel barrel us out of there, we had so much food.   They're a family run business, which I can appreciate as I have a family run business as well. They made us feel so welcome. We will definitely be back.

Some of the best prime rib around (usually).  The salad bar is amazing too...  They have a $4 burger Monday now too, which really gets the place packed.  Really good date place I'd say except for Mondays when it is packed full of people eating cheap burgers.  Really quality local restaurant all around.

If you were to ask me how I would describe Feeney's Bar and Grill, I'd say "Good food and atmosphere ruined by overall lackluster service and a rude bartender."   We had been waiting for 20 minutes before I got impatient and had to ask for service. It was another 10 before someone had come to see us. Our waitress was friendly enough but after taking our drink order she decided to walk away for another 10 minutes before coming back to complete our order.  We did not feel like valued customers at this point.  However, what really ruined the overall experience was the rude and snarky bartender. She had come to drop our drinks off but when I tried to inquire about thet waitress she cut me off and said I'm a bartender not a waitress and walked off. She may've been having a bad night, but this act certainly made our experience bad.  Lastly, I'd recommend the Salisbury steak if you do go, but the potato skins were tasteless and boring.

Prime rib is always available and it is excellent. What is missing from most of the reviews is the 80+ beers available. A really outstanding list. Fine food, but a family/casual feel. Greek choices on the appetizers is a good move.

We had not been in for a while, so when we spotted a new sign and some new additions to the front, we figured we'd give it another go.  We would have wasted less time and had a better time if we'd just thrown $100 in the trash.  I ordered the Butterflied Filet on top of mashed potatoes with the Gorgonzola sauce, my husband had the prime rib. The prime rib was fatty and gristly. The filet arrived covered in gravy.  I'd forgotten that it had the gorgonzola sauce, so I didn't mention it. But if the sauce was unavailable, it should have been brought to my attention so I could either order it without the sauce, with the gravy, or made another selection altogether.   I cut into the meat and it was either not a filet at all or it was a low-grade fatty meat...not lean and tender like a normal tenderloin.  Worse, were the potatoes and gravy...the potatoes either came from a box or were not fresh and the gravy was either over-salted or it came from a jar. I ate a couple of bites, and couldn't eat anymore.  Let me stress that this would not have been a problem if we were paying $10 at the Golden Corral.  And we recently had a similar meal at a place that was about $20 less and 3 stars more.  I am rarely picky about food, I more often bang places on their service. I probably also should have said something.  But I also didn't feel like there was a way to remedy the situation...a sad and drab place that serves sad and drab food probably couldn't have re-made the meal so it was any better.  Better to cut our losses and leave.    We went to the Cheesecake Factory where we could count on some consistency, even though we'd rather frequent our local businesses.  As for all of the 5-star reviews...that I cannot explain.  Lots of people from out of town talking about how fabulous this little hole in the wall and including all kinds of photos...hmmmmm.  Definitely not a 4-star place.  And definitely not a place where we'll take our hard-earned money again.

I came here with a group of friends for $5 burgers with fries on Mondays. We had to vallet park, which I didn't expect. We were seated promptly in a place that took me back to my childhood. It was almost like I was back in Maine in the 1980s going out to dinner with my parents. The decor...the servers...the salad bar. I skipped the burgers and just got the salad bar....it is very cool, but I was disappointed in the salad bar. There were no tomatoes and the potato salad was 100% mayo with some random pieces of potato. Perhaps I came on an off night, because my friends have been before and they love it. I'll give it another go and see if the salad bar experience improves.

I found Feeney's on Yelp.  Many good reviews so I thought we should give it a try.  I am so glad we did.  We visited for dinner.  You would probably drive right by it if you did not know it was there.  As far as decor goes, the restaurant is a throwback to the eighties for sure.  It was very clean though.  I had the Oscar Tournedos and my husband had the Prime Rib.  Both were excellent!    Our waitress, Maria, was a very nice woman.  Attentive but not overly so.  She seemed to know everyone that walked in the door.  It was easy to see that once you eat here, you will be back.  The salad bar threw me off a bit, but I liked the fact that they had cold, metal salad plates.  Everything was fresh and their vinaigrette was delicious.  My dish was beautifully presented.  My husband had fries with his Prime Rib.  They were thick cut but they were perfectly crunchy on the outside and light and tender inside.  Prices were very reasonable.  I am excited to go back for lunch next time.  If you have not been here, you must try it.!

I live in Glendale, and my girlfriend and I were on the east side to take care of some business. We got hungry at about 4:00 pm, and decided to find a local place to sit down and have food that wasn't at Denny's or fast food. We settled on Feeney's. It is one of those hole-in-the-wall places, but it is quite elegant inside. Outside appearance is certainly deceiving.   I will not review ambiance or time, nor will I compare foods with each other, because we went after lunch rush and before dinner rush and have only eaten there once. We cannot rate what they are best for, or what days are easiest or funnest because we ate on a Thursday between lunch and dinner and were pretty much the only diners at that time (which was awesome!). I ordered the half-rack pork ribs, with a side of baked potato and salad bar. She ordered the salisbury steak with a side of sweet potato fries and salad bar.  Establishment: As you walk in, you are greeted warmly. Their color theme is dark, matching the stone walls and dim lighting. It is pretty cozy, so it is not a place I would recommending taking rowdy kids. Besides, there isn't really a kid's menu. The bar is off to the right, and the dining is throughout. They do have a nice foyer for busier times, I guess. There are about 4-6 televisions throughout, with HD programming. One downside is that the patio for the smokers is in the front, but nothing can really be done to change how that is, except for moving to a new building. It is kind of secluded, so you may not have to worry about the smells. Parking is kind of small. You might have a hard time parking your limousine, but there is plenty of it. Just check it out on Google Satellite.   Salad bar: I always love the salad bars when I go to the buffet, mainly because they have all the fixin's. Feeney's is not a buffet, but hey! theres a salad bar! This one is pretty awesome, and yes, it has all the fixin's, even jello (which I found interesting). The ranch dressing is made in-house, and it is oh-my-god delicious, as ranch goes. Very sweet tasting. The only discrepancy I have with this salad bar is that it is mostly just dinner salad lettuce (iceberg) mixed in with a little romaine. I think it would be cool if they can offer some variety, like spinach, or spring mix. All the salad bar products are chilled and sneeze guarded.   Entree: The pork ribs were pretty good. They pour on the barbecue sauce, and it is thick and tangy. The meat is fall-off-the-bone tender, but I can say that mine was a little too dry; not dry enough to send back, but maybe overcooked by about 30-45 seconds. The barbecue sauce made up for it though. My baked potato was cooked to perfection. I did find it convenient that you can get any toppings for your baked potato at the salad bar. Our hostess gave us a small sample bowl of the Soup of the Day, to share, as both of us ordered the salad bar. We thought that was a nice gesture. My lady's salisbury steak came with brown gravy sauce and sauteed mushrooms and onions. She said the flavor was great, and the toppings were just right. This is not your Banquet frozen dinner salisbury. It is very hearty and juicy. The only complaint she had was that it was a little too seared on the bottom (heat a little too high in the skillet when cooked). Like my ribs, it was not enough to send it back, because the flavor was very good. This isn't Hell's Kitchen, after all. She also liked her sweet potato fries; she had them with the ranch dressing.  Customer Service: The customer service here was great. It was easy to talk to the hostess and waitress. They greeted us with a smile, and were very sociable. They really went above and beyond to make sure that our visit was top notch.   Recommendation: My girlfriend and I would definitely eat here again when on the east side. Price is okay. I do not eat anything too fancy anywhere I go (I am a student), but entrees range from $10 for the sandwiches, salads and chicken all the way to about $30 for the beef wellingtons and seafood. I think the only fault with the building is that the smoking area is in the front, so you have to walk by the smokers to get in, but it isn't like they can demo the building and make a new one. Small downside. When we went there, it was just some old men chewing the fat, smoking their cigars. I am giving them 4 stars just based on the slightly overcooked food, but that may change with time, I suppose.
Mmm i love feeneys and it also helps that its a redskins bar considering my boyfriend is a skins fan. We are there every Sunday morning

This review is long overdue! My husband and I came in one afternoon to grab lunch and we absolutely loved the charm, service and food. My mother in law was coming into town the next week so we thought it would be a great idea to bring the whole family to dinner here. My husband made the reservation but then had to change the day, time and amount of guests multiple times and Judy was the sweetest and didn't blink an eye at all of our changes. She reserved the private room for us and the service and food was amazing again! The young man who helped serve us is so nice and polite even though we had a rather large rowdy group and a cranky toddler. We are future regulars and definitely appreciate how nice and attentive the staff always is. Anyway, the reason I ended up posting this review now is because my husband is still going on about how delicious the pasta bolegnese was weeks later. Thank you!!
Best Prime Rib Ever! I've been around the country and the world. This little whole in the wall homely restaurant has THE BEST Prime Rib! You have to go to the little gem!

I've lived a rock's throw away from this joint for over 6 months now, and I didn't even realize the absolute gem that is Feeney's, until this afternoon!  I had heard an excellent review of their salad bar at work from a client, and decided to check it out! The overall feel of the place is welcoming, and up beat!  The dimly lit atmosphere is reminiscent of a dive bar (in a good way), but Feeney's is WAY cleaner and well maintained.  I saw a lot of reviews saying that the vibe was reminiscent of restaurants before major chains were the norm, and where as I may be a little young to remember such a time, I can see what they mean, and agree! Today, I actually decided to stop by to grab a quick salad to go (since I had heard that salad bar was awesome, and it is), but a quick look at their daily special (caramelized apple pork chop, oh em gee AH-MAZING!) and I knew it wouldn't be a salad dinner for me!  The menu has a lot of unique options that you don't see often, including their soup of the day, a Louisiana style seafood soup, london broil and even ESCARGOT!  I can honestly say I've never seen escargot on a menu before!  So I find their menu not only intriguing, but incredibly special!  Some of their dishes are a little on the pricey side, but you certainly get what you pay for, not only in quality and quantity of the food, but also in SERVICE! I myself work in the service industry, and I know how frustrating it can be, but as a result, I hold customer service to a high standard.  Feeney's blew my standards out of the water!  It took only a few minutes to be greeted by Judy, the fabulous bartender, who gave me a lunch and dinner menu to browse through.  I had a few minutes before another gentleman (I'm sad to say I can't remember his name) offered me advice on what to expect from various dishes.  I ended up deciding on the special of the day (that super-delicious caramelized apple pork chop), and a chocolate martini (crafted deliciously by George, co-owner). Both George and Judy were so fantastic to interact with, even going so far as to introduce me to the cooks, and other patrons!  I even left with a bag of grapefruits to take to my co-workers tomorrow and A HUG!  Which is a big deal if you know me, because I'm a hugger!  I've had some pretty awesome customer service in my day, but I can't think of a time or place when I have ever felt so welcome at an establishment I've never been to!  It's clear that the people at Feeney's take pride in their work and I can't wait to go back! From the menu to the staff, Feeney's is a breath of fresh air!  I would recommend this restaurant to ANYONE!

If you have not been to Feeneys restaurant on 12th street in Phoenix, you have not had the best meal in Phoenix. It may not look outstanding from the outside, however, order the pork osso buco,  prine rib, rack of ribs, or pasta Bolognese or the fried ice cream and you'll love it all.  100s of beers as well. The customer service is above and beyond. I don't know how anyone rated this restaurant lower than a 5 star. Thanks to all the folks there, particularly George. Outstanding!

We had our retirement dinner for our father here the other night. We were a party of seven and had a private room of the main dinning room that was perfect for out little celebration. We had checked in with yelp and got one of their free potato skin appetizers as well as an order of calamari and escargot. All were delicious and perfectly prepared escargot and calamari. We have done our research on yelp and wanted to try the prime rib and the liver and onions a couple of their specialties. Our water glasses were never empty the staff was very attentive.  I highly recommend this place if you're tired of the chain and Fox concept nonsense. This should be a local staple if you live in this area. For a party of 73 bottles of wine three appetizers seven dinners and desserts are total bill was 230.00. Wow great vale for excellent service and food!!!!

First some of my background....20+ years as a waitress, hostess, catering captain, catering business owner.    We arrived at 5 pm on 12/31.  The first words out of the hostess/owner's mouth were "do you have a reservation?"  Not a good sign.  I snuck a peek at the reservation book, and there were a handful before 6 pm but no more.  I said that no, we thought we were safe coming in at 5.  She gave us the stink-eye and  proceeded to make a big deal about "finding" a table.  This while there were maybe 2 tables occupied in the whole place.  We should have taken the opportunity to say "thank you very much" and turned around and walked away, but we did not...having been wanting to try this place for a long time.  We sat and were waited on by the hostess herself.  Cordial enough, but no offering of a wine list or anything.  Clearly getting the bum's rush from the beginning.  We opted for a glass each of the house wine since no other options were given (generally we would order a bottle).  The wine was horrible, watered down and flavorless.  We ordered prime rib (Traditional cut) for $22 each.  Salad bar was small but good and fresh.  Meals were timed quickly after the salad was cleared.  Prime rib was decent, mine was not medium rare but more medium, barely room temp.  I had the steamed veggies which were done fine...husband had baked potato.  We were quickly offered coffee which we refused...at this point we couldn't get out of there quickly enough.    While the food was decent and the prices were reasonable, it was the initial treatment and the feeling of needing to free up the table that will keep us from ever returning.  Next time we will stay and have dinner at Dick's Hideaway where we had cocktails before venturing into Feeney's.

So, tonight we went to Feeny's. This is usually a great place, but lately they have fallen down on the job.   It's not the food, which is great, but the bar.  Exorbitant drink prices.  This is Central Phoenix, not Scottsdale. Short pours and watery drinks are not what I expect.  And a cocktail waitress who doesn't listen.  Very disappointing.   It will be a while before we go back.

Good food and EXCELLENT service.  There aren't many places like this left.  They welcome you into the restaurant like it's their home.  Everyone's seems to be family - customers and employees alike.  This place should be in a Best of Phoenix list.

Before we even walked in we were greeted warmly and then seated right away. The fish tacos we had were delicious definitely the best I've had in arizona. They had a salad bar which had various toppings and tasted great. They had a great selection of beer (according to my boyfriend who is a craft beer enthusiast) and a wine list along with a full bar. All of the waiters and waitresses were extremely friendly and provided excellent customer service. The atmosphere was very welcoming.  I gave this place 5 stars because the food was delicious,the customer service was fantastic, and the atmosphere made you feel right at home. Great for a date night. Definitely going back again.

I wish I could give Feeney's more stars.   I stopped there tonight to meet for dinner, getting there earlier than my boyfriend I waited at the bar. Within 10 minutes I was having a conversation with the owner Judy, the bartender George and several of the other bar patrons. It felt like somewhere I'd been 100 times before with how friendly everyone was.   George then was our server when my boyfriend arrived. He, the hostess and even the bus boy were prompt and happy to help with whatever we needed.   The food was awesome, to solidify this being our new favorite spot. We got the New York strip steak and prime rib, both cooked to perfection.   I can't say enough great things about every part of our experience and look forward to seeing Judy, George and the gang again soon!

Warning: if you dine once at Feenye's, you'll be addicted, and you'll probably be writing a review for a 12-step rehab program that will get you out of the undeniable allure that this Restaurant/Bar has to offer. Having that said, yeah...it IS worth it!  Let me take you through this cozy satisfying experience by starting off with the appetizers that we tried; first few times we went there we were pretty much obsessed with the SAGANAKI, which is a flaming Greek Kefalograviera cheese served with fresh pita bread. We also tried, TENDERLOIN TOAST which is a to die for slice of meat lover's heaven on herbed cheese on garlic crostini. And, my go to fav' now is--GREEK BRUSCETTA which includes feta cheese, kalamata olives, tomato on fresh pita bread, with a glass of pinot noir, you can't do no wrong!   If that didn't tickle your fancy, the salad bar will. Fully loaded with your favorite greens and then some.   After we've been fully appetizerized, we also had a few of their main dishes that were defiantly worth trying twice! Last time we were there I had the CHICKEN PICATTA with lemon caper sauce and my husband had the PAN SEARED TROUT almondine. On another occasion I had the LAMB CHOPS with Greek seasoning and my husband had the GRILLED SALMON Greek style. Needless to say...DAYMN that was some good eats!  Now here's how you KNOW...you just know, that you're in for a night of class A eating, and it is when you're too full to move, but you'll say "yeah...I will take a look at the desserts menu". We had a slice of the ice cream cake that must not be named! Oh yes, it was that intense...chocolate, Oreo, and ice cream...'nough said.  If you're not sold by now, hit their bar with your friends...according to my husband and his friends, you CAN'T leave, thanks to the owner, George, who makes Feenye's Restaurant and Bar an experience that you'd want to revisit again and again.

Went for dinner last night and waited an hour to get our food  (filet, prime rib, Oscar tournedos) which when it finally came out was mediocre at best. If your customers are waiting an hour for their food because you've got a party of 20 ahead of them - at least offer them a drink or appetizer on the house. Service was friendly and attentive otherwise. Bud light pitchers are a bargain at $3.50 even if they are "mini pitchers".
We just found this place and WOW!! The food was perfect, the staff was ever so helpful and we met some of the regulars who made us feel like we belonged.  I will be back again,

Bees knees Beef Wellington! My husband and I came here not knowing what to expect and we were blown away! Not only was the beef Wellington the most amazing dish ever, the staff was also wonderful! They treated us with such gratitude and we were just as grateful for their service! We came specifically for the beef Wellington on the menu, but the rest of the menu sounded amazing as well. We will definitely be here for dinner again!

I went to this restaurant, the food was priced expensive, $26-$48! I don't mind paying for that if the food is that great, this was not... The mashed potatoes were a ball with this dark brn stuff that had chunks (who serves burned gravy?!). I live in the neighborhood and was very disappointed, not returning...

It's burger Monday! This place has the best salad bar prepared fresh everyday and uses the freshest high quality meats. A true central phoenix landmark that caters to generations of loyal customers. Amazing and friendly staff and owner make it feel like cheers... where everyone knows your name!
Atmosphere was great, but the food & service were even better!!! The pork osso bucco was incredible!!!

Went with friend, twice now. Once just for a drink at the bar, and next for dinner.   We both enjoyed our meals and the service was good, but overall, i felt like it was a place out of the 70's (not necessarily bad).  However, they were still catering to the demographic that was in their 30s and 40s during the 1970's.  (Hope you could follow all those numbers!!)   What I mean by that is:  the food selection, salad bar, decor, and overall ambiance was made for my dad or grandfather and hasn't updated for four decades.   E.G.: my dad LOVES Liver-n-Onions, and Feeney's is famous for it.   I would recommend Feeney's to people at least 60  (or wiser) who are looking to have that feel of Phoenix fine dining in the 1960s or 70s.  Any younger than that, and, well.... I think it's hit-or-miss.
Great meal we had the prime rib and salmon, everything was excellent.  The service was spot on and appreciated.

Visited Feeney's for the first time last night. My first thought was that the inside is much more interesting than the outside. The outside in a fairly nondescript building on 12th St. The inside is more of a retro-throwback to an old school steak house.   We started with escargot and potato skins (the skins were a freebie via Yelp check-in). Both were good, but neither was great. For dinner, my wife had Pork Osso Bucco and I had the Beef Wellington with a Twice Baked Potato. The Osso Bucco was very big portion of shank served on top of mashed potatoes. It was well prepared and tasty. The Beef Wellington was very good as well. A petite filet wrapped in pastry dough and covered with mushroom sauce. Twice baked potato was good as well (quite large actually..)  Overall, our experience was good. The one negative, perhaps a pet peeve of mine, was walking by the outdoor patio to enter and patio is full up with people smoking. I would prefer not to walk through a wall of smoke to enter.   N*joy...

AWESOME steakhouse, and coming from me that is quite a compliment.  I don't order prime rib out because so many places it just isn't that good, and I never order steaks out because I know how to grill them awesome at home. BUT I would gladly order either at Feeneys! Matter of fact, they are my gold standard for prime rib!  Super friendly service, comfortable but very nice ambiance, nice neighborly bar area, and an awesome salad bar. Lots of great specials, I think it is Tuesdays that you can get their angus burger for $5.   Best beef spot in town, great place to impress a date!
Absolutely amazing staff! Food was delicious, especially the beef wellington. Our glasses were full the entire time. Can't wait to come back.

Feeney's is one of my favorite restaurants.  The back room is always quiet, the service is always excellent and the food is very consistently superb.  Prices are very reasonable, especially their specials.    Monday nights are so good in all departments that I'm almost a regular with my family and friends.  Try it, you'll like it a lot.

We came here tonight for my birthday dinner, it was our first time coming here. We shared the prime rib and ribs, both were excellent. The service was outstanding, they are all very friendly and attentive. I even got a hug from Judy who is really nice! They surprised me with a complimentary slice of their delicious ice cream cake. We will definitely be back, it's a great place. We've driven by this place for years, I'm so glad we decided to try it. You should too.  FYI- I NEVER leave reviews, so this is really saying something.

Sirloin was amazing. Salad bar is great. I'm updating my review to 5 stars because the service at our last visit was top notch. Our friends had the rib eye and said it was amazing. The salad bar is always fresh and the ranch dressing is good. If you want a family friendly steak house this is the place to go!

WeJust found this place a my colleagues and I were looking for a local steakhouse. We had no idea how amazing it was going to be! Not only was the staff amazingly friendly but the food was by far the best we could have asked for. ! The regulars even make a point to come and talk to you! I'm traveling to Phoenix again I definitely want to come back here!  We had the Prime Rib and it more than lived up to the hype!  Wonderful!!
Being from Wisconsin we struggle trying to find an awesome Prime Rib in an unpretentious atmosphere. Feeny's hit the mark! Great food and friendly staff! Recommend highly!

Been here a couple of times.  First time they were incredibly nice and apologized for our food being out so slow (it wasn't) and they offered us free drinks from the bar.  Food was awesome along with the service.  Second time was on Christmas Eve.  Great service, free valet parking, and awesome food.  Steaks are always good to our liking (medium rare and medium well).  Salad bar is pretty good and the appetizers we've tried are good.  The people who have greeted us each time (I can only assume they're the owners) are so grateful and happy you're there.  We've never felt so welcome at a restaurant and they're so nice.  A bit on the "pricey" side for dinner...but it's a steak house.  Given that, it's an amazing price for the quantity of food, quality of food and service.
Simply delicious!  Fabulous service!  The Best Food!  It is our family favorite!  We love Feeny's!

This place is great! We brought a friend for his b-day and he loved it. The service is great and the cuts of steak were amazing as were appetizers and salad bar. The baked potatoes, fried zucchini and potatoes skins should be tried. Oh and the onion rings looked good too. The desserts were great! I was hoping for Creme Brûlée but they were out so now I'm hooked on the mud pie which is really really good! You won't regret eating here. It's a cute place with nice ambiance.

Every two weeks we visit from California.  I'm glad we finally decided to take the chance and visit Feeney's.  The food:  Both my wife and I ordered the Top Sirloin. Beyond my expectations the steak was extra thick and cooked perfectly. Ask your server to add extra cracked peppercorns (you'll thank me later). The side was a loaded baked potato included with the entree, DELICIOUS.  Atmosphere: The setting is low light at wooden tables. If you make a trip to the salad bar you can watch the chef cook your steak right in front of you which is pretty neat. The noise level is about a 5 out of 10 which is pretty good considering Feeney's has a full bar inside as well.   The service: We were greeted at the door and seated immediately. Our waiter George  Was on the money! Never left us waiting and kept my glass full (coldest 805 on tap).  Bottom Line:  If you've been wanting to take the shot...DO IT!

Man I wish I would have found this place sooner I've drove by here many times and thought it was just some hole-in-the-wall bar so I never stopped in please don't make the mistake that I did stopping here get their delicious prime rib I always thought that Houston has the best prime rib but not anymore I think it's the crust that they have on it and there's not a lot of fat so you can enjoy pretty much the whole thing there  au ju is pretty damn good too taste just like that pan drippings now watch out for their horseradish pretty strong stuff I cut mine with sour cream how much better another definite must is there potato skins crispy and cheesy what else is there had that Ace Pineapple Cider very good it tastes like that hard pineapple candy another thing is their salad bar comes with any meal very good also finished off the meal with a creme brulee it was good I had a lemon taste to it not traditional creme brulee but very good at that Judy the bartender was great made you feel at home and like you belong there like the other regulars that go there definitely will be back very soon
Maria was so approachable and friendly.  Our group ordered the calamari , prime rib and a wonderful mud pie for dessert.  Great atmosphere and good food

Went for dinner the other night. Had the largest shrimp I have ever seen in the shrimp cocktail!  They make their own sauce which will clear your sinuses.   Delicious burger and fish and chips. We both agreed we need to order the fries crispy next time so they aren't soggy.   Nice salad bar.   Have heard about their brunch being very good so will try that next.   Parking lot is tight so careful parking.  Could have done without having to walk through smokers sitting outside the door.

Just had the worst prime rib I have ever tried. Went for dinner at 7 with my gf. There where a lot of people enjoying dinner. Service was pleasant . Ordered the prime rib with veggies and salad bar. Prime rib looked properly served as med rare. I tried it by its self then with the horseradish and Au jus . The meat Didn't have the taste or texture I find appealing . Bottom of the meat had a slimy appearance that resembled bad meat . Maybe I just caught em on a bad night. Needless to say it was a 60$ donation. I won't be back

I came here for dinner one night because there are always cars in the parking lot and I live close enough to walk. The atmosphere was nice. It's old school yet romantic and laid back.  The salad bar is just a salad bar. There is nothing that makes it a great salad bar but I do like salad so I did eat some!   I ordered the prime rib with mashed potatoes. The prime rib was very good. There was tons of fat on my piece but that's pretty normal.  The potatoes were great.  I was shocked because you can tell they are made in house and so many places now used instant stuff.  The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is because it's a little overpriced for the area.

Saturday night at Feeney's.  Ordered the Shepard's Pie and Chicken Marsala.  Dinners come with either unlimited salad bar or soup.  We chose the salad.  About 10 items including lettuce ( not the spring mix or anything like it), tomatoes, cukes, onion, cheese, cottage cheese, pepperocini peppers, bacon bits, etc were included.   We chose from 3 salad dressings and I liked the greek dressing.  They offer cold metal plates which keep the salad cold.  The shepard's pie was large and freshly made.  Since shepard's pie is an irish dish I thought I would be made true to Irish form.  Instead,  the meat was cooked Greek style with cinnamon and cloves in it.  It made me like it a lot less than I would without these added items.  Don't like cinnamon in meat.  I then realized (duh) that this is a greek restaurant or at least the cook is.   This is also one of those restaurants who use brown sauce on almost everything.  Even my shepard's pie had brown gravy on.  Ok.  I guess it doesn't hurt.  But when hubby's chicken marsala came with the same brown gravy, he didn't like it much.  What he disliked was that it was just an un-breaded, under-seasoned chicken cutlet, plated, and then topped with brown gravy with marsala wine in it.  This is not the way to make chicken marsala.  The chicken cutlet has to be partially sauteed in light olive oil and then transferred to a pan of marsala wine sauce and allowed to finish cooking there. He said that while the cutlet was not overcooked, once you cut into it, it had no taste.  So if given the opportunity, he would not order that dish again.  The service is very good and attentive at Feeney's.  So if you like a decent salad bar and not overly expensive dishes,  Feeney's will make you happy.
Not so good.  Pricey for what I got.  Salad bar was a bonus, not sure if it justified.

Read a number of good reviews here on this establishment. Last night, my friend and I had a hankering for prime rib so we decided to try Feeney's.  We arrived and were seated promptly. Drink orders were taken. Iced tea only (my friend has been on the wagon over 25 years!!). Small glass, but was constantly refilled. Ordering was no problem. My friend ordered the small cut of prime rib (approx 10 oz) and a baked potato w sour cream and chives. I ordered the "Feeney's Cut" (the largest, approx 24 oz) of prime rib with rice pilaf. Dessert was fried ice cream. There is complimentary salad bar. Warm rye and pumpernickel breads and butter come with the dinners.   Maybe the kitchen was having an off night. Maybe the vendor supplied substandard beef. Maybe the refrigeration was screwed up. I don't know. Let's start with the salad bar. All the usual fare: mixed iceberg lettuce, carrots, 3 bean salad, cottage cheese, cici beans, bacon bits, red onions, croutons, etc. There were four kinds of salad dressings, including ranch, russian and creamy italian. The ingredients were fresh, especially the lettuce. However, the salad bar itself was mildly cool, not cold. Otherwise the salad bar, in my experience, is nothing special.  The prime rib orders arrived as we ordered them: medium rare. Small plastic cups of horseradish sauce and au jus were on the plates. My rice pilaf was starchy and stuck together. My friend's baked potato was underdone. After trimming off 20% of the meat because one end was all fat and gristle, both orders were a tad dry. There was no rub on the exterior; no salt, no cracked peppercorns, nothing. The prime rib is really nondescript. The fried ice cream dessert was well executed.  The service was good. The iced tea server (that's all he does, apparently) was working overtime. I'd like to give this restaurant 2.5 stars because I find nothing about this restaurant particularly outstanding. They served us perfectly average fare.

My husband and I eat at feeneys all the time. We love their fresh salad bar, the warm hugs from Maria and the funny jokes from Judy. Every time we go there we leave satisfied and happy. We would go there even if they served rocks for food the love we get from the owners is amazing all on its own. I recommend this restaurant to anyone who wants to experience true fine dinning.

First time here. The owner is super sweet. She waited our table.  Salad bar was an excellent perk. Very fresh and kept stocked. The prime rib was delish. Kids loved their burgers. Chicken kabob lacking major flavor but the owner changed it and let us take it home. What a sweetheart. The table next to us shared their enormous slice mud pie slice with the kids. What an awesome neighborhood experience. I would recommend for sure.

This place is awesome!! From the owner, to the staff to other diners! My 2nd time here and Judy remembered us from 6 weeks ago! The food is to die for, the prime rib is just that, PRIME! Location also great at 12th St and Maryland. Can't beat this place!! We'll be back soon for sure!

We wanted Prime Rib for our wedding anniversary dinner so I googled "Best Prime Rib in Phoenix" and Feeney's was on the Top 10.  It was amazing!! Appetizer, 2-10 oz. Prime Rib dinners & a good bottle of red wine for under $100 (w/o tip).  WE had a reservation but arrived early...they were BUSY but they got us a table right away.  Salad bar is amazing (great Ranch).  Seems to be a popular local place...the waitresses were hugging their customers...that's always a good sign!!  We'll be back!!!
Awesome food best service ever! Oh my the prime rib I have left overs for tomorrow! I recommend the twice baked potato! Treated just like family will be back!

Can't go wrong! Service is ALWAYS friendly. My favorite is Monday night burger special. Burger is cooked to perfection, flavorful and juicy! The salad bar is a nice change and always stocked and clean. The staff is always friendly, talkative and gives you that family feeling of you just walked in to your favorite aunt's house.  My go to place for nights when I don't feel like cooking or driving, as the walk is nice as well.

Great great great!!! Awesome beef Wellington and prime rib. They have great specials if you do not want to spend a lot of money. The service is phenomenal and the atmosphere is perfect. I highly recommend this place
Great Monday special (cheeseburger & fries). Customer service always good. Owner even checks in with patrons.

Loved this place!! We all ate excellent food (salad bar, soup, chicken marsala, lamb chops, chili, prime rib and delicious sweet-potato fries!) and were treated so nicely by Maria and taken care of so promptly by Sandy and Nester. Maria's son, John, cooks beautifully in the kitchen. Great food and ambiance...don't pass it up!

Woah. Not often I get treated as more than just a regular dude. I usually don't mind that, because I'm as regular as dudes can get, but Feeney's treated me like a king. Or sultan. Sultan sounds better.   The servers are fun and they clowned with each other. I like people who love what they do. We ordered the Saganaki as an appetizer, which is this plate of awesome melty cheese you eat with pita bread. That was the best thing I have ever eaten. Then the waitress comes out and she all "Hey do you guys want a bottle of wine on the house?" Well, hell yes we would. And so there we were, full bottle of a delicious red blend, 8oz steaks and a delicious appetizer in our bellies.   Might not sound like much, but Feeney's nailed it with me and my girlfriend. You guys have indeed earned another pair of regulars.
Very good Prime Rib & Beef Wellington free potato skins salad bar biggest twice baked potato on the planet yum.

The best way to describe this place is a dive bar. Incense, burning in the bathrooms, wafts throughout the place.   Shrimp cocktail with nary a hint of horseradish (seemed almost like a tomato sauce), cold baked potato and creme brûlée that, well tasted like the burnt parts of a roasted marshmallow.   The prime ribs was good and the wait staff was awesome though.   All and all I can't see how this place gets 4 stars.

The people were incredibly friendly all the way down to the cooks. Food was good, but not great for the price point. The kids loved the French fries. We had the prime rib and teriyaki top sirloin, both medium rare. Ended up sharing the sirloin as it was much better out of the two. We also enjoyed the salad bar.

Great old school hidden gem to try in Phoenix. Okay, let me be clear - this is not ruth chris, flemings, or any other upscale steakhouse. This is old school 1960's-1970's steakhouse that looks its age with the vintage salad bar in front of an open kitchen to boot. Yes, it needs up grades, fresh carpet, whatever. Still, the steaks we had were great!  First off, make a reservation - the place was packed on Saturday night. The owners are there to great you once inside and as we waited for our table guided us to the bar for a cocktail. Drinks from the bar were strong and wine was a large pour. After a 10 minute wait we were seated.  The menu is not too big but is mostly meat heavy with some greek dishes peppered in as well. We opted for the ribeye and the prime rib both with twice baked potato (upcharge but worth it!) and salad bar. Salad bar was good, not too big but, at a steakhouse all I care about is how good the meat is so...  Steaks arrive and the ribeye is marbled a little more than I would hope but, very tender and juicy - twice baked potato was crazy big - like a small nerf football! The absolute star of the night was the prime rib - awesome. Cut was perfectly cooked and crust was spiced just right.   Overall, service was good, the owners were friendly, funny and made us feel like we were visiting their house for dinner. Place had all types of people from regulars, families, couples, suits, etc. It was a very causal atmosphere. FYI - parking can be a challenge too. So yes, the ribeye was good but, I will come back for that prime rib! I've read other reviews and the prime rib wasn't that good - on our night they nailed it!   Cool spot to check out at least once if you live in the valley.
Awesome family run business !  Super tasty salad bar. A really nice variety of entrees, and daily specials as well.

A old phoenix institution.  At one time this place was known as the cork and Cleaver.  Food is excellent, I had the Philly Cheese Steak.  I have not had one this good since I left the East Coast when i was there for school.  Great place to have some beers with friends and watch sports.

My friend recommended this place to us and we decided to go and check it out.   It was Monday when we went and they their Monday special was $5 burger. We decided to start there for the first visit.   Our server was super friendly. We told him it was our first time here and he made sure to give us all needed information. We got the same treatment from him as if we ordered the most expensive item on the list. That is what I call great service.   Our food arrived and I must say, we were both really happy. I would of paid full price for that burger as well.   On the end our server came with the biggest piece of an ice-cream cake I have seen. It was on the house for us to share. How nice was that?   If you go, I can't promise you free ice cream cake, but I can promise great service, great food, great ambiance....You need more?   Thank you Feeney, we will see you again soon!

I am pretty dissappointed with this place.    I used to think it was a great spot.  But I met a friend here on a Sunday.   Had some iced tea. Did not get one refill and we were there for an hour and a half ! But we we're charged still for two iced teas.  Six bux!!!! I was a regular there.  But I won't be after that.  Terrible customer service.  I'll find a better place to take people to. Very bad customer service.   Not a place I'll be introducing to anyone ever again.

What a find!  We dropped in for a late lunch and George took care of us. The atmosphere reminded me of a better version of Monti's steakhouse in Tempe with rustic brick walls and al fresco scenic murals in each room  The food was divine. I ordered the London broil in a sweeter mushroom sauce and my spouse had the French Dip.  The quality of meat was top notch and we both practically licked our plates towards the end. If my stomach could have handled it, I would have ordered seconds.  This place is located just south of Maryland on 12th Street with simple access and plenty of parking.  We will no doubt be back again.  Our service was excellent as well, but oh wow the food!!

Welcome to 1971. This place has been stuck in a time warp for the last 45 years. That being said, they know how to cook proteins. I had the Osso Buco and it was done perfectly...hot all the way through and tender as can be smothered in brown mushroom gravy. Do not go here if you are looking for trendy gastropub fare with new fangled dishes and culinary creativity. Go here if you want and old style quiet meal with friendly service. There are lots of upscale menu items like beef wellington and lobster. The salad bar is weak at best. The imitation bacon bits are a real downer. It would be easy not to like this place, but they can cook good old style food. I am conflicted and don't really know how to rate a place that doesn't really fit into any recognizable category of restaurant. This place is just different. Try it and see if it works for you. Maybe, maybe not.....

I am not sure how they stay in business? oh wait their prices and low quality food is the answer to that question. Low quality, I am not sure what has happened to this place.. the last 4 times I ate here the meal has gotten smaller and the quality lacking. I took some friends for dinner and they asked that we not go back there again. The salad bar was dirty, the martini's were low quality. I could over look all that, but the place needs cleaned and bar needs remove the Tavern element. A few of the patrons were so drunk and loud, the manager just walked past as one of them almost feel off the stool. I will give it another try, but none of my friends are willing to go back there to eat... ( my liver and onions were Great!).

We went back there again about a week ago.   The same things that appealed to me the first time annoyed me the second time.   Why valet parking? Its like having valet parking at a Lone Star. It doesn't make sense.   The hostess is...weird. The atmosphere is odd. Why is the kitchen attached to the salad bar?   Why the stupid cartoon building wall paper?   The steak with tender but tasteless.   Basically, it was a  bunch of blue collar workers who make less money than me acting like they were better than me.   Lame.

A friend, a big fan of prime rib, had never been here and wanted to try their specialty. Since I wanted to try their prime rib also, we met up here for dinner last night. My friend arrived ahead of me and told me that he was pleasantly surprised to be greeted as warmly as if he were a long time regular, even though this was his first time in this restaurant. For our entree, we ordered the same thing - prime rib, medium rare, with baked potato. I also got the salad bar while he got soup, and also a creme brulee for dessert. Everything was delicious, especially the prime rib - it was downright spectacular. It was a great way to cap the year off, and my friend says he's so glad he finally tried the place; he now has a new favorite for the new year.
Great neighborhood Steakhouse and Good salad bar.the owners Maria and her son George are wonderful people who treat you right.

Wow! Excellent delmonico sirloin!!!!   Great beer list! Great service! The owners are welcome and inviting and accommodated special requests with a smile.  What great people serving great food. Thank you

This is a real fun hidewaway in Phoenix.  You have to put it on your list and stop in now and then.  The staff and peeps there are really friendly and accommodating.  The food is also very good (unbeatable salad bar) and some pretty good steaks.  Had the ribs but did not care much for it.  Fun bar area as well if you go on a monday-thursday when they are not crowded (bar only holds about 10-12 or so).  Anyway, mark it in your books and we'll see you there!!

Searched yelp for a Father's Day prime rib treat and found this spot and decided to give it a chance . Upon walking to the salad bar I noticed an open grill that had some sausages searing and putting out a pleasant Aroma . I felt I had made a good choice ..The Prime rib was on point along with the baked potato and salad . I will definitely be back to explore some more dishes .

Hello, Phoenix history! This was the second location of the Cork N' Cleaver chain. Back when there was a Cork N' Cleaver chain. And not much has changed since.  In my mid 20's I lived around the corner and was in quite often. Never had a bad meal. Granted - I never had a GREAT meal - but it was never bad.  I moved away - then I moved back. While I am certainly not a regular - some of the specials are just too hard to pass by. Monday is CenPho is cheap burger night. $4 for burger and fries at Feeney's and Maizies, $5 at Vig and Vig Uptown. My mom's husband is not a big fan of Maizie's decor, so we have been frequenting Vig Uptown. I talked them into Feeney's last week - and it was a great trip down memory lane. Each of us went for the $4 burger special, and we each elected to add on the salad bar for $2.50.  Nothing exceptional - it was a standard, good quality burger. Nothing flashy or showy - nothing you wouldn't have seen when they opened this location in 1965. And it still works. Well.   Specials other nights of the week include fish & chips, liver and onions, fried chicken, salisbury steak and half rack of ribs - all for $10 each, and all including the salad bar.  Tough to beat that!  In this town, it's not easy to keep an independently owned restaurant open. And keeping one open almost 50 years? Well, I think we can all count on one hand how many places have made that happen.   The food is solid, if not spectacular, the service is always decent, the prices are fair and the portions are good - glad to have Feeney's in my area - it makes me feel like I am part of this town's history - and lets me step back in time a bit.  The advantage of not having updated is when you get inside, it's easy to forget the outside world. You're in a little time warp with a full bar, well executed food and none of the worries of the real world of 2012.

Despite Nikki Jo M's negative review I think its important to experience feeny's for YOURSELF. I have never given nor heard a poor recommendation when it comes to this place. You will find this establishment has a lot of character to offer which is largly in part why they have so many returning customers. It is true the staff and their clientele have often been compared to the environment of the popular show Cheers because indeed everyone inside is very familiar with one another making for a very comfortable environment. Doesn't matter if its your 100th time or 1st time in Feeny's. For this reason it is always a good time here; whether you're meeting for drinks or dinner. Everyone inside is extremely welcoming and gracious, nothing but good people.   If the people nor the atmosphere is satisfying enough, the food alone makes up for any dissatisfaction. The menu has a wide variety of items including classics as well as new dishes, all delicious! They are known for their salad bar along with their high quality meats, including some of the best prime rib in central Phoenix.   I've been frequenting Feenys for a few months now and will continue to do so as the food along with the people continue to make for a pleasurable experience.   I highly recommend Feeny's to people of all ages and backgrounds.

Great service, great ambiance.  LOVED the low arches and brick walls inside.  BUT Prime rib was barely warm, and broccoli was even cooler.  The bernaise sauce they brought was a bit curdled.  They were busy, but not swamped.  Maybe it was an off night.

We came here for the first time this past Monday, we wanted something simple & not too far from home so based on the reviews we ended up here. As you pull up to park you get the feeling it's a quaint little restaurant, nothing fancy but a nice little neighborhood spot. Well as you walk in it's as if you've just stepped back into time about forty years, mind you the sign says established 1975....... well I think that's the one & only time they've ever decorated this restaurant! We were greeted by I believe the owner who graciously sat us in one of the mini dining rooms, you see there's I believe 5 or 6 mini dining rooms that have about 5 tables in each except for the dining room in back which was larger. There was a bar that had about 15 bar stools & that had actually more customers then the restaurant itself but we got the feeling that most everyone in the restaurant had been regulars for many years therefore we decided we'd give them a try. We decided to start with a glass of Chardonnay for myself & a Stella draft for my hubby, then we were given some complimentary dinner rolls with some prepackaged pats of butter... the rolls were the kind you'd get out of the grocery store.... very basic. We chose to start with the calamari, my hubby chose the top sirloin with shoestring fries & salad bar for his entree, I chose to have the chicken Marsala with a baked potato & homemade chicken corn chowder. The calamari came out which at first glance looked just right & you had two sauces to choose from either cocktail or marinara. The calamari was actually good at first bite & loved that they included the tentacles but the marinara was actually too sweet, also once we got to the end of the calamari we noticed them sitting in a pool of grease because they were not drained long enough..... ended up not taking home the leftover calamari. Then I was served the soup which was actually quite good but very thick & filling, you could definitely tell that it was homemade because the ingredients were nice & fresh. My hubby had the salad bar which was a basic salad bar that has all the typical fixings, one turnoff was the imitation bacon bits...FYI had no idea that they still existed!! Then our entrees came out & my hubby's sirloin that was such a thick cut was a beautiful medium & super moist, he also loved the fries.... it was actually so big that he just couldn't finish his meal. My chicken Marsala was perfectly cooked with the fresh button mushrooms & the sauce was made just right, not too thick & not too runny. The potato was just that a baked potato with some chives but like I said they're definitely stuck in a time warp!! The soup & the entrees were delicious if you want a reasonably priced meal with some good quality meats but SIMPLE, VERY SIMPLE menu that is also kind of stuck in a time warp. It basically brought me back to those childhood memories of where this was the spot your dad would bring the family for a birthday or a special occasion. I'm sure we'll be back when my hubby is in the mood for his carnivore fix but it just won't be our go to spot for a gourmet meal.

Wanted something simple yet fulfilling & I chose to have dinner here tonight.  5 stars for service. Very hands on & friendly. 3.75 stars for overall food. 4.5 stars for value  Trout almondine was HUGE & really delicious. A definite keeper. I would have preferred a little less oil/butter for health reasons.  Prime Rib- great value!   Salad bar- included with meal. Very kitsch, old school feel. Basic; lettuce, onion, cucumber, tomato, olives, macaroni salad, coleslaw, beets   Lettuce a little watery/yet I helped myself to 2 servings.  Free potato skins with check-in on yelp and then he also (I think owner) brought us a chocolate dessert (a little icey) yet we devoured it.   I will definitely return here and get fish again.  Thanks for the awesome hospitality!

Feeneys is the quintessential neighborhood gem spot that only the locals know about. They create a vibe of family and friendliness to ALL PATRONS who enter their door. A lot of restaurants in valley SHOULD go here and see what REAL CUSTOMER service looks like.   That paragraph rant and I haven't even gotten to the best part. The FOOD. From the old school salad bar to their legendary prime rib; Feeney's get it RIGHT. Not to mention it one of the few surviving places that still serves up properly cooked Liver & Onions (my wifes favorite), Beef Wellington, and Lamb Chops.

Hated it!!!  I had a pasta dish and had to pay an extra $4 bucks for 2 tiny shrimp.  My husband had a burger, which I swear would have been on the kids menu anywhere else, because it was so tiny.  Our server had absolutely no personality at all.  Would not recommend this place

I LOVE Feeney's!  Stopped in with a friend a few years ago and have been coming back ever since.  It's a family run establishment that makes you feel as if you are a part of their family!  They ALWAYS take care of you here!  So special!  Thank you, Feeney's!

When you walk into this place it reminds me of the movie Good Fellas. My brother turned me onto this place and it is fantastic. Family owned and operated. Just the nicest group of people. And the food, although not all heart smart from what I could see at our table, was quite delish!

Nice non- commercialized dinner restaurant for good steaks and a variety of good food.  Best part is the family atmosphere with the nice waiters/waitresses.  That and of course the salad bar is amazing.  Great place for a date or to hang out in the small bar for a drink.  There is also a patio area which seems to be run by the locals/regulars that are always very friendly.  Food is reasonable priced with nothing crazy or out of the ordinary.  I plan to keep on coming back and exploring all the unique menu items

This is obviously a family owned joint, and it shows. Their passion for their restaurant is evident. They were packed, and they still treated my wife and I like we were one of only a few customers. They were courteous and complimentary throughout the entire meal. The menu is very plain, but they do it right. All of the ingredients in the salad bar tasted fresh, and awesome. The California Burger is very simple, and they made it taste extraordinary. My wife loved the prime rib, saying it tasted "How beef should". They had an awesome beer menu, as well. Lots of imports and craft brews.  I will be frequenting this restaurant from now on.
Great staff,  food could use a bit of help.  Prime rib was traditional,  but I'm a prime rib snob.  Potatoes tasted like over boiled.  Salad bar needs some help.
Fun, quirky place for a drink and bar food. Great service too.

My favorite place to go any day of the week! Tonight I had a tasty juicy burger with sweet potato fries. I usually add the salad bar because it's always fresh from the garden fresh.  If you want great food at a family owned business this is the place for you.

We love this place.........we come here especially for the Prime Rib, and the awesome salad bar - who else has this anymore??!!  Always amazing, always delicious........best little late-night gem we've found in a long while.

Man!!! I LOVE Yelp!!!!  I was craving for a nice juicy rib eye and found Feeney's through Yelp.  I got there on a Wednesday night around 6pm and it wasn't too crowded so I was able to get a table right away.  It looks like this restaurant also has some Greek items.  For example they serve Saganaki (Flaming cheese with pita bread), if I was with another person, I would totally order it because I love this dish. They also serve Hummus and Pasta Mykonos (linguini with feta cheese, chopped tomatoes and chives in a garlic butter sauce).    I was very tempted to order the Greek items but I came here for the Prime Rib.  So I ordered the following: Ace Pineapple Hard Cider ($5.45) - Pineapple Beer.... No need to describe how good was this beer. Potato Skins (Free if you Check In) - Lots of cheese, bacon, sour cream and green onions.  What an awesome combination!!! Feeney's Famous Prime Rib 8oz ($21) - The meat melted in my mouth.  I ordered it medium rare, it was tender, juicy and flavorful.  So much meat for just $21.  I got it with a build your own side salad and baked potato.  They had to wheel me out of the restaurant. LOL :) :)   I can't wait to go back to Feeney's.  My mouth is watering just by writing this review.
