This is a local gem! From the outside it doesn't seem like much. However, the owner, employees, & food is awesome. Try the salad bar & make sure you get some potato salad. It's the best potato salad I've ever had. The prime rib is always a good choice too. I love how cozy & comfortable you feel when you're dining here.

From being greeted at the door by the owners to a great dining experience.. This place is a true hidden neighborhood gem. The food is awesome and rarely disappoints. If so they make it right.. This is definitely on my top 10 favorites in the valley.

My new favorite. Stopped in to watch football in the bar and have some dinner with a friend, now I can't get enough.  Prime rib is excellent, Mondays burger special is a huge burger and fries for $5 and the salad bar is fresh and crispy. So far, the food is 5 star. The staff is so great-they make you feel pampered.

Dive bar Local family owned restaurant   Great Greek and steak themes The calamari is fresh and tasty All the plates so far are cooked to perfection  Quick fast service with drink selection  Will continue to come

Their lemon chicken soup won over my daughter.  The intimate interior welcomes you as you walk in and the food is superb.  I can't believe I drove past this place for 20 years before finally stopping in.  I'll be dropping in more often.

Visited Feeneys last night for the first time and it will definitely not be the last. We were instantly provided seating although the place was packed on a Friday night. Later in the evening it was standing room only in the bar area and people seemed happy enough to enjoy their drinks standing!  The crowd was mixed ranging from young couples,  families with kids,  and older couples / singles.  The sign says established in 1965 and if you're in a mid-century state of mind, this is THE perfect place. Some of the decor is upscale (there are several dining "areas") some dated, some kitschy, some is just fun, like the disco ball hanging from the room to the right of the bar.  But this is NOT what makes Feeneys amazing. What sets this restaurant apart from most is the exceptional service. The owner himself is working his tail off making sure everyone is not just taken care of, but 100% satisfied! Even going so far as to provide a non menu item (that evening)for us since it was advertised on Yelp. The salad bar has all the basics you could want but I think the key to this salad bar was quality over quantity. There wasn't a wilted piece of lettuce to be found. Beautiful fresh Romaine with plenty of crisp fresh toppings. Cucumbers, tomatos, carrots etc. I had the prime rib and my husband had the Rib Eye. Both were excellent. My husband ordered his steak Medium rare and it was more on the rare side than medium which is perfect for him but something to keep in mind when ordering. Prime Rib is what they are known for and it lived up to the hype. The staff was exceptional. Not only were they friendly but also extremely accommodating.   Dining here is a bit like going back in time. Back to the time when service and great food was the priority!  We will definitely be back.

I'm a foodie, so trust me when I say this place is PHENOMENAL! The ambiance is extremely chill and casual, (you can show up in jeans and a t-shirt), the staff is friendly and attentive, and the food is fantastic. I hadn't had prime rib in a long while, and it was worth the wait to eat it at this hidden gem. The meat was garlicky and flavorful, and so prime I didn't need a knife! I've driven passed it at least a hundred times, and I'm so glad I finally tried it. It's the perfect place for a relaxed evening with incredible food! I'll be returning to try the rest of the menu at least once a month. Thank you for a killer night, Feeny's!

What a cute little place that I never knew existed. I arrived there on Monday night for UYE that Miss Dottsy put together for us. The best part about it was that they had no idea that we were coming. They accommodated us even though we caught them by surprise and we told them there would be at least a group of 15 of us. No problem!! The owners were so personable and the waitress we had OMG. Her name was Linda but I called her "Bubbles" because that woman has a very, VERY bubbly personalty and she made it a point to remember all our names all night.   Now their were a few pros and cons.....   Pros  It was Monday night so the burgers were only $4.00. Although I didn't have one of my own, the bite that I did take was delicious and everyone said that they were good and juicy!   The owners were super friendly. They even bought us a round of beer and gave us each a shot of Ouzo! (I had to declined but wow!!! You could smell the Ouzo seeping from our group lol)   Happy hour prices are really great!! You can't go wrong here.   Linda made sure everyone had separate checks without us even asking. Double score for that one.   I was with a great group of yelpers. Definite plus.   Cons  Parking is a little difficult because the parking is small. But hey that just means you have to get there early!   Their was a weird smell upon arriving. From what I understood, thier had been a back up earlier that day that had been fixed but the smell lingered for awhile. It almost made me leave because it was a little overwhelming. As the night progressed, it did air out.   The area we were in, was very nice until it got dark. There was only one light in that area and made it very bright, but only on one side of the table   The food that people ordered (aka the burgers) came out in weird spurts and some had to wait a ridiculously long time for their food. It was weird but not a huge deal. But it is still a con.   Now will I go back? Absolutely. It really is a nicely hidden gem of a place.

I really loved this place it's such a nice environment and I love the soup and the food was so good ! The salad bar is awesome . Maria is so amazing, the service was amazing as well . Very friendly and it is my new favorite place !

What can I say? Feeny's has quickly become one of our favorite places for dinner.  The hostess, Maria, is a star in every way: wonderful, happy, and its impossible to be a returning guest without a hug! Its just a bonus that she says "asparagus" with a Greek accent I find sexy, and my entire table laughs at me every time she says it! The busboy Nestor is usually our personal drink refiller, and a great guy all around.  The salad bar is exactly the same as every 1970s salad bar at the steakhouse your parents dragged you to, complete with GOOD jello!  Steaks are done really well, and its clear the chef cares about his customers. Maria will not hesitate to fix any that isn't perfect in her opinion, too!  The Beef Wellington is a nice treat, as is the Tornado Oscar and other specialties. Definitely try the Osso Bucco and the Greek lamb chops!  Decor isn't a strong point at all - its casual place and nobody cares how your dressed. The food is great and the staff is too!

My husband and I visited Feeney's for our anniversary dinner and we were not disappointed.   The food: Overall, I think it was great. I ordered the top sirloin and my husband ordered the medallions. He loved his dish! He didn't leave one piece of food behind on his plate. Mine was good except the steak didn't have very much flavor. I'll be honest, it tasted as though they forgot the seasoning altogether. It definitely was a quality piece of meat but lacked the flavor. The mashed potatoes were heaven though. Once I added A-1 sauce to my steak, the dish was fantastic. On top of that you get warm rolls to accompany your food. The salad bar was amazing! I typically don't like eating from salad bars because some people aren't as sanitary as they could be but this one was good. The salad was crisp and cold. The toppings were fresh and it was very clean.  Experience: The owners made us feel like family. They were so pleased to have us there on our special day. They even brought us a slice of the Mud pie with a candle and it was to die for! The owner hugged us and said "We'll see you soon". It was almost like they could read our minds. We will definitely be back again soon.

I've driven by this place many times and never noticed it!! But per YELP...I found it. Went there a month ago.  Its not what you'd expect. A little dated inside, but the staff is very friendly. (Although, our waiter didn't stop by that much and it took a while to get our order in). Anyway,  I went there for dinner (party of 8) and we got our own little room practically. So it was nice to be able to not shout at anyone (like you do in most crowded restaurants). I ordered fish and it was really good (can't recall which one, sorry--white fish of some sort) And it came with their little salad bar option. (which was nice to be able to go up and get as much as you want). Overall I enjoyed this restaurant and would go back.

This place was so sweet and welcoming. the food was delicious too. it made me feel like i was at my grandmothers or something. we walked in and a gentleman asked where we wanted to sit, instead of telling us. then there was about 2-4 ppl checking on us. they joked with us, were sweet with my kids and talked to them instead of me, which i love because they are ppl that can speak for themselves. ugh i just can't say enough about this place. definitely will visit again next time i'm in phoenix.

From the moment we walked in we were greeted and we were treated like family. Outstanding service. The gentleman hosting pulled out my chair for me and pushed it in when we sat down. Our waiter had no problem answering our questions and was very knowledgeable regarding their draft selections. Our meals were phenomenal. As soon as I checked in our waiter noticed and put in for the free potato skins. We were greeted multiple times by different employees and what seemed like the owners themselves. You could tell the restaurant is their pride and joy. Absolutely amazing experience. Wouldn't hesitate to make this restaurant our new go to steakhouse. Worth driving an hour for.

I'm not impressed in the slightest. We sat down fast and had our orders taken. Started with potatoes skins which were beyond cold in the middle and SO greasy. I ordered a burger and my boyfriend ordered the steak and lobster tail. My burger was okay but my boyfriends food... ordered medium rare steak and ended up with a very bloody rare steak which is disgusting. His lobster tail was burnt on the shell and trying to cut through it was like cutting through a thick piece of rubber. Our waitress dropped our food off and is never to be seen again. We waited 20 minutes until we could find a worker to help. We spoke to a gentleman and he said he would get the waitress but it took 10 minutes before we realized we'd be here waiting another 20 minutes for someone to come around so we just left. Poor service and poor quality. Not a place I will recommend
We just enjoyed our Christmas company party there for the third year in a row. Everyone loved their selection for dinner. For a small place, they handled our service for 18 nicely. Thanks to all!

Feeney's is a tradition in my family...It is my mom's favorite place to grab a bite. Let chomp down and Opa Opa Opa at Feeneys..  ~The Good~ Service. Hooo boy, the service. As soon as you walk in its like your family is welcoming you in. I am not a big "don't touch me bro" kinda guy, but the hostess (and I presume owner) is a sweetheart. She took me by the shoulder, made me feel amazing and took me to my table. I had a bunch of flowers for my mother and she made sure I got a big pitcher of water to dunk them in. I did not ask but she was persistent I needed the pitcher. Now its one thing if the service is great, but its another if they provide smiles but crap food...not here.  I got the Pan Fried trout in Lemon Caper Sauce...out of this world. I rarely get fried foods, but it wasn't drenched in oil. The sauce was a bit salty adding the capers in, and really meshed well with the trout. I will try my damnedest to replicate that recipe now. I love trout, and boy did they hit a home run. The salad bar which is attached with almost all meals here also hit the spot and was delicious. Happy hour was available, with almost all drinks being 3 bucks, including wine and well drinks. I got some Cabernet, which tasted about right, not bad, not amazing, just right for the dinner I had.   As for the ambiance and mood, I love it. Quiet and comfy, the lights are perennially dimmed, creating a cozy atmosphere. The staff who are quick to refill drinks and always helpful keep the ambiance rolling strong. I also like the slight hints towards Greece on both their menu and on the murals inside. Very much an independently owned restaurant vibe, which as you know well I really really dig.  Finally, their menu is eclectic, especially seafood. They have 4 seperate fishes on their main menu at any time: Pike, Trout, Salmon, Orange Roughy. That's pretty damn good for a small mom and pop place. They fly the Pike in directly from the lakes of Minnesota fresh, which is great. Overall, strong food selection as well outside of seafood, with dishes like Beef Wellington and London Broil to note.   ~The Bad~ Its an older location gang. You see all the reviews mentioning the former tenants and such. You can go outside, look at the roof and notice its older right away. Inside the walls are mainly filled with murals and it is dimly lit. Some people may not like this set up...actually I know a ton of people who hate any place relatively quaint and dark like this. Too bad for you. Also the prices are a bit high...$17.99 for my trout dinner? A bit much. They have to make their money somehow, and fish spoils quickly so I get it...but still, for trout? Oh well, thats my only real gripe.  ~The Downlow~ I saved the best for last: Their Happy Hour. This place has a spectacular happy hour guys. Every day is a new food special, so you never will go a day without a real kick ass special. Some days it isn't a price special, but a different food item. For example they had Walleye Dynamite the other day, which my father said was very good. Their Tuesday (I believe) Burger Special is especially of note...very inexpensive.  They get 4 stars for strong service, quaint ambiance, Great Happy Hours/Daily Specials, and a good selection on the menu.  Enjoy a Phoenix tradition and stop by Feeney's!

Overpriced not even pretentious.  Dinner place comes with a choice of potato but twice bake is $2 more.  WTH ?  Really, at $20 plus on average a dinner entree?     Dinner of steaks were mediocre at best.  I have had better seasoned beef at a bar and grill for much less money.  Price is not the major issue but the place dated, dark and reeks of old.
The staff was super attention, the prime rib was incredible and the cheesecake was the best we ever had. Thanks Freeney's

My husband and I had dinner here a month ago.  Always meant to eat here, but  20 years ago, we were too broke, and later we'd pass it, keep on driving and say "next time".      Then we were broke again... :-)    I bought a Restaurant.com certificate, and we headed over.  Two words:   Really good.    Most of the reviews here sum it up well:   Retro, outdated decor.  Old-school salad bar which includes Jello.  Career wait staff.  Funky add-on, remodel areas.  Low ceilings.  Tight, weird parking.  Our food was prepared perfectly to order.  I had the filet medallions with the gorgonzola wine sauce- yum!  My husband had prime rib, perfect.    The salad bar was fresh with LOTS of choices.  Service was friendly and competent.    The mood in the place was familiar and comfortable- not a stuffy, pretentious feel.  I enjoy an eclectic mix of clientele, and that's what they have here.  No one looking to impress anyone by being at the local "who's who" location.    Just local folks wanting a good dinner, in a comfortable place.  Three words:  We'll be back.

If your looking for the best prime rib in Phoenix this is your place! The staff was incredible and loved the family owned feel of the place! It was beautifully decorated for st paddys day and received some free potato skins which were delicious. My mom and husband got the fish and chips and were very impressed , the fish was cooked perfectly. The offer a incredible salad bar with an entree order. Job well done! We will be back!
Very small yet quaint restaurant. My fiancé ordered the prime rib and lobster and enjoyed every single bite. I ordered the California burger which was delicious. Will visit again

Unfortunately, I didn't have a good experience with Feeney's. I'll start with the bad and end with the good.  First, the patio is tiny. If I were to sit on the patio, I had to share a table with someone else. Secondly, although the the wait staff were friendly, service was slow. I had a beer before the meal and requested that I get another when the meal came. My second beer came after I was finished eating. The waitress made the excuse that the keg needed changed. I get that, but it doesn't take the entire time of a whole meal to change a tap. The locals sitting near me suggested that I get the prime rib. $20 for the 8oz; based on the price, I was expecting a decent cut, but not exceptional. I was severely let down. I am aware that prime rib is fatty, but this one was more than half fat and gristle. $20 for about 4oz of edible prime.  Now for the good. The waitress was friendly and called me by name. I think it takes an impressive amount of effort to memorize your tables by name. Props to her. The potato skins appetizer was very good and had an adequate amount of sour cream on the side (I love sour cream). The baked potato was made well. The other patrons were obviously regulars and a whole conversation was happening all around me. They jumped right in to introducing themselves and included me in the talk. Finally, the horseradish with the prime rib was very tasty, with just the right spice.  I will not be returning to Feeney's for a meal, but I think it may be a decent place to drink.

I've been here a couple times now and like it more, and more each time. First off they have the best Saganaki I've had in a restaurant, the cheese is very sharp and salty like it should be, and the portion size is very generous compared to most other places. I love the old school salad bar- ice cold metal plates, bacon bits, beets, macaroni and potato salads, jello, etc, reminds me of restaurants I went to as a kid. The dressings are really good and homemade, I heard one of the employee's dictating the recipes to another last time we were there. I've had the pork chops, a couple pasta dishes and the fish and chips, all were very, very good. The tartar sauce w/ the fish and chips was so good, it was surprising. That had to be homemade as well. Last time we were there we had the Mud Pie for dessert, another old school item, and it was huge and delicious. The staff is always super friendly and on top of everything. Great, great place and I'm looking forward to more great dinners here.

We have had dinner at Feenys several times and we have always enjoyed going there. Maria  the owner is a Beautiful classy lady with a great personality. And her son George is also very friendly they make you feel very welcomed.Ed the cook is "awesome" his plates always satisfy a appetite, I enjoyed the prime rib that Ed prepared for me perfectly it  was delicious and John enjoyed his pasta dish very tasty.

My first time visiting and it was phenomenal! The owner greeted us, as we sat in the lounge by the bar. Brought us a free appetizer because it was our first time. I ordered a glass of wine which was ok, my fault in the choice I made. However,  the owner opened a private bottle for me that's not served by the glass, and proceeded to pour me one glass so I could try it(ended up finding out it's his favorite wine). Two glasses later after he generously topped off my 2'nd(without me asking of course), I've found one of my favorite reds. How absolutely amazing of him. It's really about the little things during your dining experience. This did not disappoint. Thank you to the owner. The food was also very yummy, we split a ribeye that was done to perfection. We will be back again. Highly recommend.

I came here for lunch and really enjoyed it. The food was great...even the salad was delicious.I also liked the dim lighting and medieval feel.I plan to come back here for dinner with just my significant other:)

Yelp said it's a good place, hubby wanted to try it. Won't be going back.  Took close to an hour to get food, ordered the shepards pie.  Wasn't very good and the gravy tasted like outta a jar.  The place is old, dark and gloomy.
I've eaten here several times when I come to town.  The owners are very friendly and the steaks are fantastic.  Great atmosphere to relax on a business trip.

I have driven by this place 100's of times and never stopped here. Every time I passed by the parking lot was full and I always saw the sign out front with this giant steer on it. As my interest finally got the best of me, Twyla and I decided to give it a shot for dinner.  Upon arrival, we were greeted at the door with a warm welcome and then walked into the restaurant and seated. May I say that the service here was spot on and the staff amazing. Our food was exceptional! The twice baked potatoes are the size of Texas and every course was directed with timeliness and care.  A mother and her son are the owners and operators. They reside from Greece but have been here a long time and operating this fabulous restaurant. From the chilled pewter plates at the salad bar to the "never having to ask for anything, including to go boxes." this place was awesome! I'm calling it a hidden gem because most people would not know to go here.  It resonates the old steakhouse feel with dark wood and rustic decor.  The bar screams to be hung out at and the crowd there was good. I added pictures of the menu as the portions are massive and the prices are half of other local steakhouses. The wine list needs a boost or I would have given this establishment five stars.  So, both Twyla and I would highly recommend a night out. The owners are so fun and hospitable but so are we... Enjoy!  #Vino2 #Vinosquared #Vino2ultimate #Irishcatv2 #jimsboisset
Great place! Excellent prime rib. The staff and owners are very friendly and service is great. I love this place and go there frequently. It's a little neighborhood gem.

We had dinner last Friday night, party of about 20 of us... This was my first time to Feeneys, but have friends who have been going there for many, many years... I've heard so many different opinions from, Fantastic to old dirty dive! My first impressions were good, nice old school feel, very old building, but I like nostalgia. I think we are to quick to knock down an older building to rebuild, and I wish we would keep some of the older establishments around.. Anyway.... Feeneys has a good and fresh salad bar with the BEST homemade blue cheese dressing I've ever had, I can't rave enough about the blue cheese, I think they should bottle & sell it! I had the "Feeneys cut" of Prime rib (rare) with there delicious au ju & horseradish sauce (ask for the plain horseradish to add to there standard sauce, it makes ALL the difference) Gotta say Best Prime Rib I've had in years! The service was very good as well, the owner actually waited on us & my party didnt make it easy on her, they asked for separate checks, and she did a phenomenal job.. Everyone enjoyed what they ordered & heard the lamb chops were awesome...Two thumbs up! The only reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5, is because there was some sticky stuff on table where I was sitting when I arrived, but they quickly cleaned it up for me! I'll be taking my Momma to Feeneys for Prime rib & of course salad with blue cheese dressing very soon!

We decided to stop into Feeney's as my boyfriend had never been and it has been years (10 or so) since the last time I was there. When we arrived we were promptly greeted and seated.   with menus. I had a glass of wine and by boyfriend had a vodka/tonic. My wine was huge! Great deal. We checked in on Yelp and redeemed our potato skin appetizer which was great! fried perfectly and crunchy!!! I knew that I wanted prime rib as I was craving it and they always have great prime rib. My boyfriend ordered the smaller filet. We both had the salad bar and he also had mashed potato and I had the twice baked for a few dollars more. When my dinner came out I was SHOCKED at how LARGE my twice potato was! I knew I was going to take it home for leftovers as well. This thing had to be 2 lbs don't let the picture fool you...it was dense and huge! I hate my prime rib which was cooked perfectly and the creamy horseradish was PERFECT! Not to mellow and not to hot! My boyfriend enjoyed his filet and taters too and ate every bite. Service was great and we will certainly be back in the future!

Service was AMAZING. Tasty food. A family owned joint for sure. Everyone working there made sure we were well taken care of. 10% discount from Yelp. Comped dessert. Lovely conversation. If I'm back this way again I'll be back there.

Best lamb chops I have tasted since I visited New Zealand. Sweet potato fries were the best I have ever had. I am definitely returning to this restaurant. Beef Wellington was cooked perfectly and the sauce was exactly as it should be.
We ordered our food, it was bland nothing had flavor and the price was outrageous. The service was horrible we never got asked to have our drinks refilled  We will not be coming back

Sentimental college days date location!  Revisited this old fav of mine and it was "cheese-burger night!  So a few of us had burgers which were delicious, but I had to stroll down memory lane and have my old favorite the base-ball cut sirloin.      All the food was very good and the salad bar was delicious and had not changed in 29 years!!   The proprietors were very hands on and involved with service the entire evening....very refreshing to see and independent locals place survive this O-Bama economy!  Please give Feeney's a try!

Monday nights you get a sirloin burger and fries for $4 -- awesome deal. Good burger. Add cheese, avocado, bacon, mushrooms, etc. for a small up charge. Get all you can eat (simple) salad bar for an additional $2.75. TVs with Monday night football in the bar and on the patio -- great, chill Monday night option.

I like Feeney's. I must because I have been eating there for over 10 years. I like the owner of Feeney's (partially because his name is so much fun to say - Elias Pantazopoulos - but he will answer to Louie). Over the years, there have been very few times that Louie hasn't stopped by our table to make sure everything was ok. And although I would like to think it's because I'm special... it's really not. He genuinely cares about the people that come to his establishment and wants them to feel comfortable expressing their likes or suggestions.  This place is small and mostly dark (the perfect place for a quiet dinner with your someone special) without one iota of pretentiousness. The brick walls, archways, and dark wood accents give it a little bit of an East coast feel topped off with the tiled exhibition kitchen complete with a shiney copper hood.  The menu is mostly comprised of great steaks and sea food, but there are always a large selection of daily specials that are sure to mix things up. Most meals come with a trip to the salad bar... but beware, portions are pretty large, so make sure not to overload before your meal ever arrives. They have a full service bar up in front and if you are looking for a different game venue, grab a seat in there. The drinks are very reasonably priced, strong, and never run dry. They also have a hearty list of apps that you can supplement your drinks with, for the perfect game day fix.  If you haven't over-indulged with your meal, you MUST order the Mud Pie. It is a ginormous slab of goodness! Dark chocolate cookie crust, loaded with coffee ice cream and topped with a super fudgy ganache layer that you will want to rub all over your body.  Feeney's is a genuine rarity. It's a great little steakhouse that serves up above average meat but doesn't have a foo-foo bone in its body. Call ahead to make sure they have a table and head over to Feeney's. Oh and as Laura B. mentions, they are on restaurant.com so you can get a great deal on any meal.  I have to go now... there is a piece of pie calling my name!

Omg. The hubby and I ate here last night for dinner on our random getaway to Phoenix AZ.  Its a diamond in the rough!  The staff was so amazing. You felt the love when you walk in the door... the food was so tastey!  And never once was our cup empty! We were so full and satisfied Well worth the drive from Riverside CA. The hubby says we'll definitely be back!

I'm so happy I stumbled upon this gem!  I had driven by a few times on my way home and decided to stop in for a drink.  The bar is small and full of life.  The same regulars have been warming the stools for years and they have the crazy dynamic going on that's so entertaining.  As soon as I sat down the bartender introduced me to everyone and they treated me like one of the gang from there on.    To eat I've had the filet mignon and burger - both were full of flavor and cooked perfectly to my specifications.  Everyone you encounter at this place is so warm and friendly, you want to keep coming back!

I'm updating my review of Feeney's, as when I read the review of my initial visit, I was sort of shocked. It is now one of my favorite restaurants in Phoenix.  First, make sure you check out their website for the nightly specials. Wednesday night is particularly great, with your choice of 5 freshly prepared entrees, including potato or vegetable, AND soup or salad for $10. Nice.  Second, when you check in on yelp, look for the instant 10% off coupon. Immediately. For that use. Not a "10% off after 4 visits" or a one time use. Every time. Nice.  Third, I am always a bit taken aback by the sincere friendliness of the staff, especially the owner. She always remembers us, even when we haven't been for a few months and we are always greeted with a big hug and a hearty "Hello! Welcome back!". Nice.  Fourth, the salad bar that I was unimpressed with in my first review impresses me now not for its variety, but for its consistently fresh and always well stocked bounty. Not only leafy salads on the salad bar, but some slaws, a few pasta salad choices, and lots of very fresh veggies. And I'm a sucker for the carrots that have been shaved into curls and the cool fresh ground pepper mill. While you are getting your salad, the chef(s) will routinely visit with you, as the kitchen is right behind the salad bar. Nice.  On my visit last night, I started with the onion rings as an appetizer. They were good. No flavorgasm like the ones at Durant's, but then how could they compete with those? I had the $10 special Salisbury steak with mashed potatoes and salad. Salisbury steak has been much maligned by the Swanson TV Dinners of old. When done right, and Feeney's does it right, it is a flavorful piece of ground prime steak. Here's a hint, if they ask you how you want your Salisbury steak cooked, you pretty much know it is going to be better than the chopped steak meal you are going to get at other restaurants. The mushroom gravy is an added treat for both the steak and the mashed potatoes. Another at the table subbed the fresh veggies for the potato, and they were a nice assortment of zucchini, squash, and broccoli. Not a limp, greasy garnish like you get some places if you opt out of the potato portion. Nice.  Another hug upon our leaving. Goodbyes from the waiter and the bar staff. You can easily see why most of people you see in Feeney's are regulars. Count me as one now.
Best burgers in town.  Went with a co worker during lunch, food was great and service was wonderful.  A must vist again.

My boyfriend and I found this place while searching for a restaurant that serves Beef Wellington.  We went for dinner tonight and I can say this is our new favorite spot.   We started with Calamari which was good. It came with 2 sauces, a cocktail sauce and a chunkier tomato sauce which I loved.    I had the Wellington and my boyfriend had the sirloin and shrimp. The Wellington was fantastic! so juicy and the gravy was rich and delicious. My boyfriend likes his steak "Black and blue" which is not common and usually when he orders it that way it comes out too done. The chef came out and asked him how rare he would like the middle and when it came it was perfect. His steak also came with 2 gigantic shrimp that were sweet and tender.   We finished with Creme Brulee that was very creamy but not overly sweet. (Which for me is a good thing!)  The prices were very good. We basically had a 4 course meal for about 90.00 and everything was wonderful! We will be going back and the sooner the better.

Old school vibe. Had a pretty good rib eye here.  The salad bar was legit.  I went thru the line twice.  Nice neighborhood feel to it. The bar by the front was dimly lit and a place I wouldn't mind hiding out and drinking in one afternoon.  Prices were reasonable.
If you like that rustic, trip down memory lane type of steakhouse this is the place for you!  The food and staff were great!  Do a check in w/ Yelp you get 10% off!

I used to come for the booze (I actually still do!) but I wound up bringing my family in for dinner while they were visiting from out of town. Being the zealous consumer of lamb that he is, my father ordered the Greek-style lamb chops. Needless to say that every time he's in town, he HAS to go to Feeney's and have the lamb. He has since tried the pork chops (also Greek-style) and is just as much of a fan of those. I've brought in other family since who are also nuts about the lamb. So bottom line, if you're into lamb, come here and take it Greek-style! Not a lamb eater myself, I usually get the filet mignon. There is just something about the way the filet is prepared, old-school style and not a lot of bells and whistles. Bells and whistles are not needed because it's just so damned good: tender and flavorful. What else is delicious? The calamari is AWESOME-probably one of my favorite in any restaurant anywhere. The service here is above and beyond. Maria and George and the rest of the servers treat all of their customers like family which is why they have so much repeat business. In addition, you will never have an empty glass in front of you, whether is beer, wine cocktails, soda, coffee, even your glass of water is always refilled. Sure there are other places in The Valley that are fancier where the food comes to your table almost too pretty to eat, but that comes with a price tag and often a nice appearance is used to mask inferior quality. Not the case here, you always enjoy a good, down-home, no-nonsense meal with great service and all at a VERY reasonable cost.

HAHAHA so I work in a restaurant and rarely allow myself a night out. My boyfriend and I had a long day at work and decided to smoke a bowl, get a great bite to eat and a bottle of wine. We decided on Feeneys because several of our friends highly recommended it. I ordered filet and a bottle of wine and absolutely loved every bit of it. Amanda was taking care of us and she was absolutely phenomenal. Then the owner had some sort of meltdown. She came out screaming about smelling pot and that she'd cut off someone's legs if she found out they smoked. Uhm...hi I just spent an hour and a hundred bucks in your restaurant but now I'm leaving and never coming back because you're a psycho. Thanks.

Not bad and not great.  This place is more atmosphere than anything else - it feels like a place you'd bring your grandfather to get a steak, with dim lighting and an old been here 30 years neighborhood bar feel. There's lots of beef on the menu and the food is decent.  I tried the Beef Wellington  - basically a filet mignon cooked into a puff pastry with gravy on top.  It was pretty good, especially the steak, and I kinda wished I'd just ordered the meat on its own.  The gravy was too salty.  All in though, Feeney's is worth trying at least once.

My girlfriend and I had come in here on Saturday. I was planning to bring her on a Wednesday but she was so moody and angry...it was hard to accomplish anything with her. Wednesday is when they have some pretty good specials at good prices I hear, Thursday, and one other day I believe.   In any which case, the parking wasn't bad...I got a spot up front. However, the parking lot was like a strip design so if you have a large SUV like I do, you might have issues with reversing and leaving, etc.   The place looks pretty old school. There' s a small patio in front for smoking and presumably eating as well with some coasters and a TV inset...was pretty nice.   There's a small bar to the right when you go in and a salad bar and probably the cooking area front to the rear. I presume the bathroom is off to the side as well. When you get in, there's a small waiting area/lobby to the left. It looks pretty comfy on the couch.   We were shown our seats immediately. We waiting a few minutes for our server to get our drinks while guys were cleaning up our table off to the corner meant for two. They were quick about it and the busboy made some small talk, everyone seemed fairly friendly.   After our waitress took our drink order and appetizers which, was a potato skin appetizer we got free since I checked in on Yelp!Mobile and crab stuffed mushrooms, we probably waiting another 15 minutes for her to come back and take our order. My girlfriend picked out a filet mignon med-rare with rice pilaf and a side of steamed vegetables instead of the soup or salad. She didn't want a salad and they were out of soup of the day or the soup. I got a New York strip steak with a rice pilaf and a salad. You can either get your salad before or after entree. I went ahead and got the salad before entree since I'm a fat kid that needs to fill as fast and often as possible. They have a salad bar which has some pretty decent selections. There some macaroni stuff that I wanted to try too but I didn't, sadly. About 10-15 minutes after I got my salad, the steaks and stuff came. My girlfriend thought her steak and food was pretty good. I thought my steak was pretty good even though it looked way more rare than I usually would get. Let's be honest, when she asked me how I wanted my steak, I wanted to tell her, "breathing." Heh, a page taken right out of Chuck Norris' book.  Anyways, the food was good. The check came out what I expected and we left pleased. I would come back again since my girlfriend liked it here.

As I was reading the rest of the reviews of Feeney's prior to lodging my own, I realized that I have never been there for the dinner hour! So I can't comment on the lights, candles, and ambience aforementioned.  As Arik mentionined, Crystal is one of the best bartenders I have ever met! She has the best combination of customer service and sassiness that many of us bar regulars love. I've been to Feeney's a few times for drinks, and always had a great experience. They have a really cool patio for smokers as well.   I think the thing I love about this place is that there are so many regular fixtures, presumably from the neighborhood. The times I have been there have been the early happy hour times, and it feels like a neighborhood bar, except the median age of patrons is closer to my parents age than mine. But not in a creepy way.   I have had lunch there once, a few months ago, and it was very fine (3 stars). I had a club sandwich, my other 3 companions had sandwiches as well, and we were all satisfied.   The 4 stars comes from the bar, its patrons, and the bartenders.

Love the Location, it is right around the corner from our home. So we decided to give this a try for the first time.   The staff is super friendly and let us know about the special right away. Im glad we tried it out. The 5.99 burger deal was way worth it. It was also delicious! The Gf also got the fried ice cream which was very tasty.  We will be back to try out the prime rib

To say that this was disappointing is an understatement. My husband and I wanted to give this place a whirl to celebrate our 5 year anniversary. We set up a reservation through Open Table and were excited to have a lovely steak & lobster/crab dinner...until...  Not sure if they lost 1/2 their staff that night (no one was paying attention to the door), but we walked in, looked around for a host/ess or a sign that said "Seat Yourself". Not seeing either option, we kinda lurked around the bar area and stood watching a basketball game. About 5-10 minutes in, a woman said she would be right with us. Once we were seated, we were asked immediately what we would like to drink (yes, before we had any menus). Hubby ordered a beer and asked for a wine list. Then no contact for another 10-15 minutes. The table on the side of ours was muttering something about not seeing their waiter for awhile.   Prior to arriving, I researched their menu and was really looking forward to trying their Oscar Tournedos dish (filet topped with crab meat and a bernaise sauce over mashed potatoes). The waiter, initially unsure as to whether they still had that dish, informed me that it is no longer on the menu. He said that the filet medallions would be somewhat comparable as long as I like gorgonzola cheese. I went with it. Hubby had the ribeye medium rare, and we ordered the potato skins appetizer (ONLY because of the Yelp deal when we checked-in, otherwise I don't order potato skins) and the salad bar. I ordered a glass of Malbec.   The wine was delicious. the potato skins were tasty, if a bit overdone. The salad bar was really good. My steak was a little underdone (I ordered medium (as I was informed that if I usually order medium well, then medium is the way to go), it came back as medium rare. Not necessarily a deal-breaker for me (since it was a quality piece of meat), but I am unsure as to where the gorgonzola was underneath all of that thick brown gravy. *sigh*   Once the plates were on the table, we never saw our waiter again. We never got any water refills. We were never asked if we would like another beverage even though our glasses were empty. After asking for our bill 4 times, the lady from the beginning of our journey meandered her way to our table, mentioned something about it being a tough night (I think the cook walked out?), and asked if we needed anything. I mentioned that we were disappointed with the service, that it was our anniversary, that we were really looking forward to the experience but were disappointed in how the evening went, and, to add insult to injury, not only did she disregard all of that, she also charged us for the potato skins.   The table that was looking for their waiter in paragraph 2 was still waiting for something when we left. If I were a betting woman, I would say they were just waiting for the opportunity to slink out of there since it seemed as though no one really cared one way or the other.

Very good old school Steak restaurant that reminds me of how they used to be when I was a kid. It is kind of nice to see that a few places like this are still around. The prices are reasonable and the food is good. The service is superb. The best part is they serve dinner till 10 pm. My only complaint was the steaks are cooked a little more well done than most places so order it a bit less done than usual.

Old Fashioned Steak House worth coming to Excellent Food and the Shrimps Cocktails and Potatoes Skin Oooh mama. First Time here we had  great time and order the Prime Rib it was delicious. Excellent Service.....

Somebody mentioned the liver and onions here were good.  Didn't take much after that for a small gathering to check it out. They were indeed good.  We also had a couple of shared appetizers. Loved the feel of the place. After the baseball game was over it got sort of quiet which surprised me on a Friday evening. The service was great the whole time. This is a place I wouldn't mind coming back to to try something else on the menu.

My hubby selected Feeney's for my bday dinner because I have been dying to try a Beef Wellington after watching Hell's Kitchen for years.  Pastry and beef, hello!!!    This place is one of those old school restaurants, tables, and feel.  I remember these places when I was a kid.  We were greeted right away and she turned out to be our server too.  Maria was awesome and her support staff.  Our drinks were never empty and they came to check on us multiple times but not to the point that they are standing over us.    We ordered: Chicken Wings with Ranch - Those little things are spicy but so crispy.  The ranch helped to cut some of the spicy.  Cream of Broccoli Soup - Thick, creamy, and good.  Beef Wellington - OMG, it was good.  It was so good, I could not stop eating.  The mash potato and gravy was a great side to go with my wellington.    Lamp Chops - My hubby loved it!  He said we are coming back!!!  They bread that came with the meal was so good!!!  I ate both pieces of the rye.  My husband had the pumpernickel.  The server found out we were there to celebrate my bday, so she bought me a huge slice of mud pie (ice cream).  It was so good and they sang happy birthday to me.  Too bad, I was only available to have a few bites.  I was so full from the wellington, but happy bday to my hubby, he inhaled MY mud pie.  =)

We came here around 5 on a Sat. evening and it was already really busy! Surprising for such an early nite.  The ambiance was really cool, brick walls, old-time feel that we found refreshing among so many new and modern places everywhere else.   The server was very busy but attentive and helpful. We both ordered chicken dishes with the salad bar, which was well-stocked with a lot of options, all of which were fresh.  The prices were fair and the portions were reasonable.  I wouldn't say the food was anything extraordinary but it was tasty, hot, and filling.  We'll be back when we're in that area of town again, for sure! :)

Went here again for the second time in 3 months, and like the first time I was not disappointed. The owner, Maria, is wonderful and so nice, and the rest of the staff is great as well. The food is so good, I have tried the Prime Rib and the Beef Wellington, both are worth eating again and again.

One of my all time favorite places. Judy tending bar during the week has locals and long time customers coming in just to see her. She's a doll and a great person to boot. Great little salad bar. Always fresh and well stocked. Burger Monday, Brunch on Sunday and their prime rib. All top notch.
Wow! Had the beef Wellington and I can say it was incredibly delicious! Wait staff was very polite and knowledgable. Will be back for sure! No drive could keep that from happening!

I cannot believe the recent great reviews of this place! Had been meaning to go there for awhile and finally did last week as a pre-Christmas dinner, yuk! The place was dead on a Saturday night, we passed on the salad bar that looked lifeless and tasteless after our server basically forced us to go check it out. Mistake on her part as we saw some of the kitchen prep space that was filthy. The whole place seemed to be in need of a good cleaning. Now the food...I've never had a twice baked potato with so many lumps... My filet was cooked medium like I asked but no seasoning whatsoever...this place had me thinking of writing in to bar rescue or restaurant impossible for them! Definitely would not recommend or return, a shame we spent $80 here.

Feeney's is a great locals place that has been around for years. I only started going there a couple of years ago and had probably missed out for a long time.   When walking in, you are immediately greeted by one of the very friendly family members. We had a party of five and made a reservation on Open Table (I think all restaurants should be on Open Table by the way). Right away we were taken back to our table. Feeney's is small with several small rooms of tables so I would recommend making a reservation for any size party.   We placed our drink order, margarita for me, martinis or beer for my friends. They serve about 100 types of bottled beer and have a few on draft. This is when I made my check in on Yelp and was awarded a free potato skin appetizer. Why not!?  When our server returned with the drinks I mentioned our free appetizer. He said, "I saw you check in, I've already ordered it for you."  Nice!  For the main event three of us had the prime rib, one had the ribeye and one had fish and chips. From what she was saying, the ribeye was outstanding, she could not have been happier with it. I was told that the fish and chips was also very good. As for our prime rib, it was good but needed a little boost in flavor. Still it was a beautiful cut of meat and tender. I was the only one who had been to Feeney's before and have only had the prime rib, so obviously it was normally outstanding. As I said, the prime rib had always been good in the past, it was probably just one of those not so flavorful slabs of meat that the restaurant received. I will return and I will order the prime rib again!   Let me back up to the choices that come with entrees. Salad bar or soup and your choice of side item. I opted for the salad bar as I always do when dining there. It's a nice little salad bar with several choices of toppings. They also have several choices for your side item with a small up charge for a large twice baked potato ($2). It's very worth it!  I am not a dessert person normally, but I always get one there. The mud pie!  Coffee ice cream, Oreo cookie crust and chocolate topping. Mmm! Delicious!  All and all this is a fantastic place. Support a local family owned business and check out Feeney's. They also have daily specials!  Enjoy!

Family restaurant with amazing service! The flaming Greek appetizer is beautiful and delicious! The bartender/server Amanda is incredible and always makes sure you are happy and content! The selection of brews is hard to beat!

WOW, first time here and had such a wonderful experience! The food is simply delicious and the service is the friendliest I've had ever! The owners were present and greeted every table as they made sure to keep a tidy environment. I will be back and recommend this place to others.  It's such a nice non-chain local spot to support!

Visiting from out of town, my friend found Feeney's from an Internet search.  The three of us were in the mood for steak and this place seemed like it fit the bill.  We were seated immediately, towards the back of the restaurant.  That's person number one we encountered.  The second person came and filled up our water glasses.  After waiting awhile a third person came to take our order.  Not one of the three people we encountered asked if we wanted anything else to drink besides water.  Meanwhile at the table across from us, wine and other cocktails were brought to their table and also bread.  We thought they may be dignitaries because of the great attention they got compared to our pithy service.  When we saw the bread, we asked for an order.  It was brought to our table but the server appeared put off by our request. Our steaks finally arrived served by yet another person. The filet was dry and served on tomatoes.  The ribeye was overcooked.  The prime rib was nothing to write home about.  When we were ready for the check we had to ask someone for it and yet another person brought it out.  Overall, service was poor to say the least.  The meal was meh.  Find somewhere else to go, or perhaps if you are a dignitary, your experience will be different.

I found this place because my mom was craving liver and onions. Upon arrival, it didn't look like much from outside, but once you go in, you encounter old world charm. My mom who's originally from Germany fell in love with the style of this restaurant/bar. We were greeted as soon as we walked in the door and were seated. Thereafter the owner followed up and recommended the special of the day- 3 tacos made with prime rib. I ordered the special and my mom ordered the liver and onions. The food was delicious- my mom is picky and she loved her food. My tacos were outstanding- the meat perfectly cooked and so tender- they came with an avocado-garlic mayo which was to die for- and also rice pilaf which I did not like- it was a bit salty.   The owner offered drinks from the bar- however we had coffee and water.  They have daily specials at great prices.   Pros & cons Pros- the owner is very attentive and he genuinely cares about his customers. I noticed all of the staff working together to get their jobs done and they all smiled. The restaurant was clean, and tables bussed immediately. The food is superb, the meat is fresh and tender. The bar appears to offer many different beers and drinks. Great vibe throughout and they have an outdoor seating area right at the front entrance.  There is also a larger dining area towards the back which was well lit.   Cons- it was a little dark when you first walk in-front dining room- low ceilings contribute to this, the bathroom is a bit small and not handicap friendly ( my mom uses a walker and it was very hard to get into the larger stall) and there was a sewer odor in the restroom. No lemon offered for my water. We will definitely be returning when we are in the area; we found a new favorite.

Five stars for Judy period. Five stars for fish and chips special-  get it. Five stars for cozy ambiance. It is a Phoenix treasure. Its not perfect but some things matter more than others. Great little fireplace at the back.

Chances are you haven't heard of Feeney's.   It used to be the Cork 'n Cleaver twenty or thirty years ago, but it has since split off and now is its own steakhouse and bar.   I can't speak thoroughly as to the food, since it has changed substantially since my last visit to eat, but I understand that the menu has expanded and has a Greek flair to it now.  The bar, however, I can speak to. It is probably the darkest bar I have ever spent much time in and I love that about it. Their motto should be "Redefining Shady."   It is a dive in many respects, but the regulars may not agree with that. Drinks are cheap and easy to come by in the very small bar area, and everyone seems to know the bartenders by name. If they know you and like you, you can even request music or bring in a CD and they may play it for you while you sip a smokey gin and tonic. But play your cards right, because they absolutely play favorites.   The patio is comfortable for one group only but, it's all yours if you get it first.

So glad we found this place on yelp!! This place knows how to do potatoes... We tried the potato skins, mashed and a twice baked... all were quite tasty! Happy hour every day from 3pm-7pm. Service was on point!

Had 45 minutes to kill so stopped in for a beer and a bite. Pleasantly surprised they're still here! Wow! Nice appetizers, had killer Calamari! They've a beautiful little lunch menu, great house wine, & bartender Judy is lovely. We'll be back for dinner to try the Prime Rib for Tom, Hummus for me... lobster ... crime brûlée - that menu will keep us busy. Nice steakhouse atmosphere, beautiful menu - Can't wait to try the steaks.

This restaurant has been our go-to for every Christmas Eve since the late 90's.  How things have changed!  We've always loved the ambiance and the ability to have a family gathering without a lot of hassles, especially on Christmas Eve.  2016 was different.  They had ONE PAGE of a menu for us to choose from, and all of their steak/prime rib prices were about $8-10 over the prices we used to pay.  The three adults ordered prime rib and asked for medium or medium-well -- our prime ribs came still mooing!  in addition, we had our six-year-old grandson with us.  I asked for a KID'S MENU -- they have NONE!!!  There was NO WAY on EARTH I was paying $24.95 for 10-oz. prime rib for a SIX-YEAR-OLD (this was the cheapest  protein on the menu!)  They wouldn't even offer him a hamburger or chicken fingers -- NOTHING -- NO ACCOMMODATIONS WHATSOEVER.  He ended up eating crackers and french fries. For this reason alone, we will not be eating at Feeney's EVER again.
This was a little gem of a place we happened to find, good food, good service, funky older location, try it!

My bf and I came here for Valentine's Day and we're very happy we did! We chose the salad bar since tomato soup was the only option that night (neither of us are big on tomato soup). We were slightly bummed because we knew how typical salad bars are. Well we thought we knew! Feeney's salad bar is so fresh and delicious though! They also offer potato salad and macaroni salad which was an awesome bonus. Next we ordered fried zucchini. BEST fried zucchini we both have ever had! Melt in your mouth buttery, without being soggy nor undercooked. For our main dishes I got the filet mignon (butterfly cut, well done) with mashed potatoes and my bf got a huge ribeye (medium well) with fries. My entree was on the smaller side but so filling and juicy even though Maria (the owner and sweetest lady ever!) cringed when I ordered it well done lol. My bf's entree was humongous and he had to throw in the towel about 2/3 of the way through it. We both loved our entrees! Only downfalls were the wait time for our meal and that they weren't offering twice baked potatoes that night. But it was a holiday so it makes sense! We will definitely be back again:)

Two stars because our waiter was so terrific. Neat place on the inside. Food was terrible. - steak overdone - gorgonzola sauce is thick brown grave made from a mix - no gorgonzola inside. Very expensive for what you get - so disappointing.
Very friendly staff . Ambiance was nice with warm rustic wood everywhere. We had the Prime rib and the Salad bar. Food was fresh, hot and tasted great.

Great food.   Even better service.   Lamb chops must be ordered Greek style.  Made my family feel like their family.   Even went out to find me matches for a birthday cake.   You'd be a fool to skip this restaurant.

We've been dying to have dinner here (happy hours have been top notch.)   The old school ambiance, complete with the classic salad bar is worth the trip alone.  The Manhattan Chowder was maybe the best I've had.  The Prime Rib and Beef Wellington were solid choices, particularly with the yummy twice baked potatoes.  The lamb chops were flavorful but could have been a little more tender.  Probably the only thing that we wouldn't try again is the Shepherds Pie.  However, the highlight of the meal was the impressive Baked Alaska for dessert.  We'll be back!

We will be back! Maria was a delight, the prime rib was phenomenal and the cheesecake was some of the best we've ever tasted. The Yelp free potato skins were so-so but uhh they were free so whatever. New neighborhood favorite, for sure!!

Drove by here a thousand times, first time stopping in. Cool little place. Nice atmosphere, friendly staff. Nice allotment of locals, friendly bunch. Decent selection of wine, top shelf Liquor and draft beer. I recommend giving Feeney's a try. I will be back!

This is a great little hole in the wall.  Apparently theyre categorized as a steakhouse? Whatever. Ive never had a steak there but Ive tried a LOT of the rest of their menu. Delicious. Their reuben is my fave.   I love the atmosphere here. It looks a little fancier than it is. Very chill.  It's actually a great place to watch football on Sundays.  Pro: technically, theyre a Redskins bar.  Con: technically, theyre a Yankees bar.
Don't be afraid of the location. Small, older neighborhood place that has a lot to offer. Came here for brunch on a Sunday and it was amazing! Prime rib eggs Benedict is great!

This place is walking distance from me, I went in once but it took nearly 20 minutes to get a glass of water and a menu, at that point I walked out, maybe they were short handed. Went back again and it was not to busy, order the world famous prime rib and sadly I have to say I wasn't really impressed. The grilled shrimp and the au jus sauce were pretty good but the steak just lacked everything and it was cold, I was to hungry to wait another 15 minutes for another steak and clearly that can't re-heat the one I have. Maybe down the road I will give it another try.

I wrote a less-than-stellar review of Feeney's and I've taken it down. I've taken it down because the owner/operator reached out to me immediately after the review posted. He offered me my money back and a free meal. I will accept neither.   Can't ask for much more than that, right?  (A working food thermometer...he'll know what I mean.)  While my own experience at Feeney's is in the past, one has to be impressed with a restauranteur who cares. He DOES care and my guess now is, if you go there the owner will INSIST you get satisfaction. That's good enough for me.

This is where you go to have a good steak! Absolutely the best service and the owner personally served us and was delightful. The steaks were cooked to perfection, huge baked potato and a great salad. When you first pull up to the building you're wondering if you're at a dive bar or a restaurant, but once inside the ambiance is warm and wonderful with sectioned off rooms for quiet dining. This was our first time in and we will definitely be back and recommending it! 5 stars  all the way! P.S. The fried ice cream and creme brûlée was AMAZING!
$4 dollar burger special Monday nights! Beer and drinks are a bit overpriced, but the week night specials are worth it.

This is place is solid.  It's not fancy; it's in an old building with a low ceiling, but it's family run and very welcoming.  I like to support places like this.  Much better than a chain restaurant.  The chicken piccata was delicious.  All meals come with your choice of soup or a trip to the salad bar, plus your choice of sides.  Portions were solid.  You won't leave hungry.

Had a great night here with my boyfriend and new friends. First time and it was amazing. Food and service was above and beyond what I expected. The place is out of the way and looks dodgy from the outside but very warm and pleasant on the inside. Kinda pricey but worth it.  We tried the London Broil and it was tender and well seasoned. Also had a "Envious Passion" martini....it was radioactive green and was sensational!  I recommend this place for anything from hanging out with friends or family to a romantic dinner. Well worth it.
6th time here, never disappoints.  One of the best Mexican restaurants in the valley. Service, price and quality of food is 2nd to none.

Took the wife out for a birthday dinner. Kudos to the whole staff everything was excellent. Daughter burger came out late and they took it off the bill without being asked. Definitely a place for a special occasion or just a great meal. Will be back again. My only complaint is that I didn't find out about this place sooner.

Feeneys, you win. I really tried to like the place. We've been there four times. Cheap burgers on Mondays, who can resist? Welll, I now can. How hard is it to cook a hamburger? Apparently impossible. Four times we have ordered both of our hamburgers with little or no pink, and five times (we sent one back twice!) they have come back bloody. Tonight, they returned it on the same bloody bun.  Feeneys, PLEASE teach your cooks what well done means! Fully cooked doesn't mean cinders, but it does mean NO PINK!   The staff is generally friendly and welcoming. Drinks are only fair. The salad bar is great. I give a lot of leeway because I really love small, local restaurants. But really, if you consistently can't cook a hamburger to customer specifications, I can't keep going.

I have been a regular customer at this restaurant over the last several years and in the past have been satisfied with the quality of the steak that I  order.   But when I ate at the restaurant last month (April, 2014) and ordered the Teriyaki sirloin, I got one of the worst steaks I have ever eaten.  It appeared to be a different cut of meat in compared to what I am accustomed to eat there.  The Teriyaki sauce I was given was a watery liquid with a hint of teriyaki flavor and nothing like the pungent sauce I have been given in the past.   I have also noticed other changes in the service.  They used to serve warm slices of delicious bread, which have been replaced with rubbery rolls. I won't go back to this restaurant.
I make a damn good Clam Chowder but Feeney' is the best!!! Absolutely delicious! Hands down the best service and dining experience around!

This place has been on my list for a while. It is a small brick building that is sort of cramped inside. There were a lot of older people at the bar inside and there is also a patio outside you can smoke at. The parking lot was sort of cramped too and they also valet available.  I think I could have made a better selection off of the menu. I ordered a new york strip with a baked potatoes. The steak was very bland; in fact, everyone at my table had ordered a steak and they were all putting A1 steak sauce, salt and pepper on their meat. I was appalled by this because you should be able to eat a steak that costs upwards 20 dollars without having to put A1 or salt on it. Once I was done battling my steak the baked potato I had ordered with it was too cold to enjoy.  The salad bar that came with my meal was good, I don't have anything bad to say about it. The people that ordered soup instead of salad enjoyed theirs. I think this is the wrong place to order a steak from though.  The server was very quirky but did a fine job taking down our orders. Unfortunately when it came time to split the bill she got really confused and a person from our party accompanied her to the register to help her out.  Overall it was not a bad experience. I am willing to give it another shot and try something different off of the menu.

Delicious!! Everything! Great place to take out of town guests or a date . Good for families too! burgers are delicious... wiping my chin...ooh and they have a great salad bar. Try the Beef Wellington and Calamari for sure.
tried this restaraunt due to excellent yelp reviews, so glad I did! Had Prime Rib, it was wonderful! Best prime rib I've had in a long time! I highly recommend this restaraunt!

I was really excited to go to this restaurant because of the amazing reviews. Here's the nitty gritty. The service was excellent. Everyone was extremely friendly, gracious, and warm. I felt like I was at a real mom and pop joint. The place was clean and extremely accommodating considering my two toddler boys were running amuck (yikes!) The bad: There's a smoking patio RIGHT next to the entrance. I can't stand the smell of cigarette smoke and it kind of sucked having to walk my kids through it. The meh: the food. As much as I want to give this place a great review for the food (because their service was so great) but I really can't. The free potato skins were okay (yelp checkin deal), the dinner rolls actually were pretty good, the baked potato was... nothing special, and the ribeye was meh. I was especially disappointed with the ribeye and so was my husband. It wasn't horrible, it wasn't great, it was just okay. Maybe my high expectations were the problem, but maybe not. I'll stick with our favorite steakhouse for now (Bobby Q).
Five stars for the prime rib!  The best I have ever eaten.

I love a local place where the regulars are smoking outside and taking their spots at the bar which is where I ate. Started off by the nicest lady greeting me and making me feel like a regular even though this is my first visit. I ordered the fried zucchini as I love that appetizer. This one had actual flavor in the breading and you could taste the zucchini and was delicious. The chicken vegetable soup tasted homemade. I don't know if it was but it tasted it. So good. The trout almandine was the perfect portion size and do I really need to say why the baked potato was so good? Why can't everyone make a perfect baked potato? The flavors on my meal were outstanding.  NOW.... most won't agree with my review. Most people like that trendy... mediocre... Luke warm greeting by hired kids as hostesses (I don't go to Hillstone any longer after years of patronage because I just got tired of the pretentiousness of the staff.... you work there... stop acting like that makes you better than me) and food that is good but not outstanding and the prices about 7-9 dollars more than the food is worth.... I mean.... 5-9$ for a bake potato other places? Please. This is a place where you have to choose from many popular items on the menu and you can come back 2-3 times a month or more.... because it's like eating at home but in a restaurant. I was happy to eat here. I will definitely be back. If you need to see and be seen go to the new places. If you just want to eat a good decent meal.... Feeney's is it. Old school. I feel like everyone from the cooks to the very nice bartender.... George was invested in my dinner.... oh the lady who nicely greeted me and talked to me on the way out?..... THE OWNER. good luck with that at any trendy Phoenix restaurant. Mealand appetizer with a good glass of Merlot.... $35. I feel as though I got my money's worth. I mean jeez I just spent $348 with tip for dinner for two at Steak 44. I don't think it was $300 better than my meal here.... even though Steak 44 is still my favorite restaurant. Please try this place the next time you get tired of being disappointed at other places. I'm thinking your review would be 3-4 stars. Not me. I like and miss this type of restaurant.

Wow...this place is A++++!  Judy was absolutely hands down the BEST server/bartender I have ever met my entire existence.  I had the baby back ribs and they were out of this world.  My friend had the burger and was also very pleased.  Their beer selection was way more than I expected - maybe over 75 bottles to choose from.   Seriously, this is a place I will remember my whole life.  Judy, if you're reading this, you're the best!  Thanks for making us out of towners feel right at home.

Salad bar was small,not many choices,but the ingredients were fresh and tasty. Sirloin burger was ok,bun bigger than the burger,bun was drab,toppings were small and wilted,French fries were sparse and partially raw. Once a bigger party came in,our waitress "dropped" us--ignored us. It was my birthday and kind of disappointed with whole experience,won't go back. 13 north should of been my first choice,wanted to try something new...oh well. Definitely nothing special.

Went today for brunch for the first time. I haven't been to Feeny's at all for years, but was pleasantly surprised to find an updated interior while still maintaining the usual charm. We were greeted warmly by Amanda, our server, and seated immediately. The food and drinks were top notch and we will definitely be back again!   The prime rib eggs Benedict were delicious, as was the French toast. Come try this neighborhood hangout!

The decor immediately catches your eye. It's very inviting, yet with a vintage feel. You definitely feel either a time warp or a country warp. We really liked it. Gave us a free app for checking in on Yelp. I started with the salad bar, then got ribs, a double baked potato and veggies. It was good. The double baked potato was amazing. They brought us a free dessert. The staff was friendly, the restaurant was clean and the prices weren't too high. I would for sure go back.

If you haven't tried Feeney's for Sunday brunch...DO! It's a truly delicious selection of Mediterranean cuisine...Cretan Dakos, Tsoureki French Toast...a great iron-skillet vegies frittata with goat cheese and aioli. And the bright and shiny Amanda behind the bar!

Been here two times now and the second time was better than the first.  Great food and drinks at a great price.    This is a perfect neighborhood bar/restaurant and I have to admit I hate telling you about this spot as I would love to keep it all to myself, but it's so good you all need to try this out.

Decided to celebrate our new Phoenix home by visiting Feeney's. The pork osso bucco was the best I ever had and my husband said the liver and onions was as good as his mom's (very high praise)!   We will definitely be back to this wonderful place. We are looking forward to becoming regulars.
Had the filet medallions.   It was totally delicious!  The service was great as well.  The owner greets everyone like they are old friends.
Absolutely love this place. Great regulars. Go in on Mondays for the cheap hand ground burgers. The Tenderloin Toast app is awesome!

I find it very difficult to write this review. I really like to patronize the little guys and the independent restaurants. So to write a bad review for one of them is very difficult. Feeney's has been in central Phoenix for many many years and I really wanted to like it but our experience was so bad, I cannot in good conscience write a good review. My aunt and I decided to go to Fenney's for our monthly girls night dinner. My husband and I had been there a few months ago and did not have a great experience but I really wanted to give them another chance because of their long standing in the community. My aunt and I had an equally bad experience starting with walking into the restaurant and not being greeted by anyone for more than five minutes. We stood at the hostess stand and waited and waited and waited for someone to approach us. I could understand if they were busy but we were probably two of only five people in the entire restaurant. When we were finally approached it was by a young waiter who seemed very unhappy with his job and seemed put out by having to interact with us.  He asked us if we had reservations which was laughable considering there was no one in the restaurant!  When we said no, he hesitated and looked down at the reservation book and then hesitated some more and finally sat us.  My aunt ordered an iced tea with a lime instead of lemon. The woman who took our drink order who I think was one of the owners said that was fine and then promptly brought my aunt and ice tea with a lemon. Seems like a little thing but starting out the evening it seemed like a bad omen. I ordered a glass of Chardonnay which was not delivered and I had to ask again if I could get my glass of wine. We looked over the menu and I asked about the beef Wellington. The owner said she could not make me the beef Wellington because the oven was broken and the pastry would not turn out properly. My aunt and I were confused as to how a restaurant could be operating without a working oven but we proceeded to order steaks.  My steak was good but gorgonzola sauce was not hot and was sort of congealed because it was not hot enough. The steak I ordered as medium and it was delivered very well done. My aunt's fillet mignon was good but the baked potato was overcooked and shriveled on the outside. The salad bar was so sad. There was a small amount of romaine bag-type lettuce in the  lettuce bowl and many of the toppings were empty. There were no tomatoes, no cucumbers, and there were several other containers for toppings that were empty.  We were there at the beginning of the night so I am not sure why the salad bar was so picked over. The service was also horrible. My water glass was never refilled, I was never asked if I wanted another glass of wine, etc.  It was overall not a great experience and we ended up spending over $100 so you would expect at least a minimal effort on the restaurants part. I've given this restaurant two chances and now we will move on to some of the other restaurants that have opened in the central Phoenix area.

Ok so I take my wife here because of the reviews.  First I have to say the area is not that great. Second there are people smoking right by the front door on the patio. Now these things dont really bother me to find a really good food spot but this is not it. What it really is, is a bar with food expensive food that tastes like its from The can not fresh.  I did get a free potato skin appetizer for checking in on yelp. But they were not that great. I really wanted this place to be great I ordered the beef wellington med. rare but it was well done and and the gravy and mushrooms were from a can and it taste just like liver. Wow it was gross.  My wife had the same problem but her meat was at least better than mine.  The Salad bar looked like my middle childs salad bar...Terrible,  that should have been our sign to get out but we didn't.   Though I would say the service is nice. But unfortunately We will not be coming here again.  $90 later! Man i was really wanting a Beef Wellington.  Well looks like i will have to try some place else. Update...20 minutes later I threw up. Man I feel like I have been Gipped!

I've been going to this restaurant at least once a month for the past 6 years. The fish, steak and prime rib dinners at Feeney's are excellent  and include one of the best salad bars I've seen anywhere. A basket of fresh rye and pumpernickle bread and butter is included as well.  The prices are very reasonable and the service is above excellent.. They really want to make sure you're enjoying your meal and have everything you want. The Mudd Pie is incredible and gets 5 starts all by itself.

Went here for lunch with family for my birthday and it was awful. Took 10 minutes for someone to come over to get a drink order from us. We were informed she was the bartender and the only one working the whole restaurant, so felt kind of bad. BUT, 30 minutes later we were still waiting for our hummus to come out. Our lunch came out much after that and it was just so so. I had a pasta dish with chicken that was kind of bland, mom had fish and chips which she said were just ok. Burgers looked good. It was just Meh. They would've been better suited having one bartender and one server cuz that wasn't fair for her. Dont even know her name as she never told us, but she was nice.

Don't go if you can't understand the ambiance of a 70's/80's steak house. Do go if you enjoy an old school salad bar, great steaks and lamb and excellent service. This is not The Palm or Del Frisco, not trying to be. Old style and old fashioned friendly service by owner, family and staff. Ribs, and lamb chops, Spanokopita (sp?), twice baked potato and a great salad were our choices. Enjoyed these sitting at the bar and encountered a lovely and very helpful bartender. We plan to return often!!
Good solid Ma and Pa Restaurant.   I had no idea this Restaurant was here, and highly recommend you try if if you've never gone.  The Atmosphere is quaint, cozy, and great for a date/conversation.

This was the first place my uncle brought me to when I moved to Phoenix. I just retired from the military, from the moment I walked into feenies I felt at home, Maria and Judy have a way of making you feel at home.  I ordered the club sandwich with French fries and a salad bar. The best steak fries and freshly ground pepper with the salad bar I was hooked. As I continued to visit feenies and have become a regular, everyone that works and visits feenies has become my second family. I've explored the menu and it just keeps getting better and better, I've also made some odd requests (gravy and rolls), and George is always there to accommodate my every request.  Amanda  the bartenders joyful spirt is always appriciated. I bring all my friends and family to feenies, and the whole crew always makes everyone feel at home.
