The new brunch menu is amazing, George is the master mind behind it and he continues to make great progress.

Only thing preventing a 5 star review is that our steaks were slightly overcooked and there's the possibility that the cheese on the salad bar may have been imitation.  My wife and I went here for a quick dinner out after seeing some of the good reviews on yelp and noticing that we could get some free potato skins (Which were by the way excellent).  I had the London broil, and my wife, the fillet mignon. Mine was very rich but hit the spot as it was exactly what I was looking for the time. Than my meat was cooked about the way I wanted it and was very flavorful. My wife's was a little bit overcooked - she asked for it medium and it came out medium well. All meals come with free salad bar and one side. The salad bar was okay, nothing special but had the essentials and it tasted pretty good. The steak fries that my wife had was actually quite delicious (I had vegetables :( ).  The Decour the place is like a classic family eatery/pub. old-school, and I appreciate that. They have daily specials the best of which is five dollars for a burger and fries on Mondays. If I were in the mood for a burger I would've had that; I will definitely go back to try that next time. Our server was named Maria, and from what I can gather she is the owner of the place. She has a thick Greek accent and was incredibly friendly.  All in all it was worth it and we will go back sooner rather than later.
Always enjoy it here. The Monday burger special is always good. If we're having drinks we the margaritas.

Feeney's is a great old school neighborhood restaurant. They have awesome specials ($4 Burgers on Mondays, $10 bottles of wine) and the food and ingredients are always good quality.  Last time I was there I had the baby back ribs and they were delicious. Fall off the bone, incredibly moist and the sauce was tangy and yummy.  I love the salad bar, it has canned beets as an option and I think that rocks. It also has garbanzo beans and potato salad.. Yum!   The service is great and they make you feel like family. I'll definitely be back.

This is one of those places you'll feel comfortable. The place you want to go to get away from the chain restaurants. There's a patio/ waiting area. Style is old wood and brick. Take a minute to get a drink at the bar, maybe catch a few minutes of the game. There's an adaquate salad bar included with most meals. I tried the full rack of baby backs, no sauce. I can't be sure, but I think their dry rub has a slightly sweet cinnamon base. Ribs weren't quite fall off the bone or really meaty, but they were tasty. I kept getting that cinnamon finish. Next time I'm trying the Prime rib; talking to regular patrons, they recommended it.
I had a philly cheese steak and my fiance had the beef Wellington ..Both were great. This place is also accommodating to the little ones. They got chicken nuggets.

Amazing. We came for our anniversary and had made a reservation through open table (although reservations are not necessary). In the comment section we put that we were coming for an anniversary and as soon as we walked in we were welcomed they said happy anniversary. It really put a personal touch on our experience. The food and service are top notch and always amazing. We had prime rib and steak  medallions which I am already craving again. I can't wait to go back.

My husband wanted prime rib and he wanted to try something new so I went on yelp to find reviews on steakhouses in our area. I came across Feeney's and they had 4 stars with quite a few reviews so I thought that was a good start. I had never heard of them so I was a bit hesitant since I'm a pretty big foodie and eat out 4-5 times a week. We were game and went for dinner. The ambiance is old and kinda dark but not in a creepy way it had a coziness to it. The greet from what I suspect was the owner was warm and inviting. We ordered wine which they had a nice selection and apps...calamari. The calamari was seasoned well but just a bit greasy. Still a decent start. I ordered salmon and asparagus, the Mr ordered prime rib...I enjoyed my salmon. It was cooked perfectly and seasoned... Hubby said his prime rib was very good also. They had a salad bar that comes with your meal but I shun buffets or any good that is not delivered directly from the kitchem so I passed... but my husband tried it and he ate his whole salad. We ate good, had good service and the price point was very good our meals with wine and an appetizer was $88 so in comparison to most steakhouses that's pretty good. We both said we would go again. Its not fine dining bit definitely solid and a great neighborhood spot. The food was good.

I had heard great things about Feeny's and I was excited to try it! It is definitely a dive bar type scene, which is awesome because you can be comfortable and not have to worry about proper dining etiquette    It took a little while to get service in the bar's dining area, however, once we got service, our drinks came promptly. Ordering food took another hot minute and when we got our so told famous prime rib, we were a tad disappointed. My date got the smaller prime rib and I got the biggest option (more protein, right?). I also opted to pay the extra charge for the twice baked potato. While the food was good, my prime rib came out cold. I had to send it back to be reheated because it seemed like I had reheated it in a microwave. When I got the prime rib back, it was hot, juicy, and amazing! Side note, the salad bar was classic, fresh, and awesome!   All-in-all, I would come back, but I wouldn't sit in the bar area and try to enjoy an entree style dinner. The service was exceptionally lacking9' that area. The food was good, but you have to be assertive if your food isn't up to par with the prices they are charging.

Want great food, great drinks, and great people...well then you should be at Feeneys!  This local phoenix staple is a must visit.  The owner is friendly and fun. The food is classic but with a modern twist.  The bartenders are attentive and will quickly learn your favorite libation.  Feeneys is always my go to watering hole for any celebration, great for small groups or large parties.

Other reviews said they had a great salad bar so my  girlfriend and I went there on Mother's Day just for a nice salad. Not sure who felt it was great but we found it looked average and decided to go elsewhere and left. Restaurant looked nice and regular menu a bit pricey so overall we can only comment on the looks of their salad bar. Go to Ruby Tuesday if you only want a well stocked salad bar for decent money.

I have been here on several occassions.  Most for the Monday night special $4 hamburger which is one of the best I have tasted.  Quality meat. They have specials every night and mostly the same things.  I had the prime rib special one night but nothing to write home about., Salad bar is good but not great.  Not, a lot of choices, just average items. Small semi private dining areas with about 6 to 8 tables in each. Bar area which also has an area of dining tables.  Be sure if you sit at the bar to ask if the seat is reserved as there are locals who come in and if  you are sitting in their seat will let  you know.
Secret of the neighborhood   Friendly staff***** great prime rib***** Salad Bar***** great value******  Great classic Steak place recommend *************************************

Loved my NY steak but you won't if you don't like garlic. Heavily seasoned.  My friends prime rib was so fatty he only ate about a third of it.  Service was very friendly but our table was  so near the bar it ruined our experience.  Paid way too much for dinner to have to listen to a bar full of local dudes watching football.  Finally, I was actually excited for the salad bar. It has been a long time since I've been to a restaurant that actually still has a salad bar. It was unimpressive.

We were looking for a good steak dinner while visiting from out of town and we found this little gem.  Food and service were both fantastic.  Great prime rib!  Very casual, comfortable environment.  We will return.

Excellent and quick service. Check I. For the first time and they give you free potato skins.   I had the Greek salmon. It was the best I have ever had. Salad bar + baked potato and huge portion of salmon for $20.00.   Even got a visit from Mr and Mrs Santa Claus.

This place was old school when it old school was in session.  I can't spot any changes since it was one of the original Cork N' Cleavers - maybe new carpet, but that may be it.  The salad bar is so old school, it still has jello - not jello shots - jello.  And since, I'm old school, I'm a fan of the salad bar.  Monday 4 buck burgers with 2.50 salad bar is the only food you'll require for the whole day.  Decent burger too.  Good barkeeps - they remember your name or call you hon (old school).  The food is pretty basic, but they start with decent ingredients and prepare them well.  Had the prime rib a couple of weeks ago and my view is that the only way to eat prime rib is to have it breath it's last on the way from the kitchen to the table.  It was early enough in the evening that they were able to deliver a tasty hunk of meat that was as requested.  If you're into modern, contempo kinds of joints, Feeney's won't be for you - but if you're in the mood for dark, old school, slightly seedy (in a good way) - then Feeney's  might just fit the bill.

Had the Envious Passion, and was duly impressed.  The salad bar was nice and fresh, and well stocked.  The London Broiled was tender and delicious, the au jus was very savory.  I had a wonderful time, and would love to return.
Diamond in the rough!!! Best food I've had in ages!!! Hospitality is out of this world.  Would recommend this to anyone.  Fall off the beaten path and try this place out!

I came to Feeney's looking for steak with my family. I ended up ordering the lamb chops which did not disappoint. However, I finished off the remains of a teriyaki steak, and loved every bite. The mashed potatoes were tasty, and the gravy was excellent. The salad bar at Feeney's was a pleasant surprise that both I and my family enjoyed. If you're looking for a Greek restaurant, Feeney's is the place to go.

Confession - I am remiss in writing this review.  Feeney's great meal and service was an excellent compliment to a great evening with friends!  You see, this raucous bunch took the place over on a Saturday night and while we were by far the loudest table they didn't mind a bit.  From @AZvern to @audreyrlwyatt to @TheDottsyZ to @ThomasWSmith to @lupnacca to @chrissyP71 to @cutepup8191 we all had a great time and enjoyed the old school food and service very much.
Will not go back.  Too noisy. Food not cooked all the way. Site is to Review. Correct it, Do not remove it.
great food, great atmosphere, great service!! if your in Phoenix you must eat here!!!

Love the live music. Seems like a good place to just hang out and have drinks with your friends.  Service: pretty good. The staff were very friendly.  Food: I had the Salisbury steak. It was alright. I should've gotten the prime rib!  Tip: Don't forget to check in on Yelp for free potato skins!

I'm a regular. A nice Greek family owns the place. They remember me and treat my family and guests like royalty.  I stopped by near closing one night after taking the kids to look at Christmas lights. To my surprise they made a couple of phone calls and next thing you know, Santa Claus was at my table.  5 stars for service. 4 stars because food quality has been inconsistent. Never bad, but one of their chefs is hands down better than the others.

I am SO HAPPY we found this place! Thank you yelp! There are definitely some pros and definitely some cons. Let's start with the pros. We made a reservation and they had it ready when we arrived. House red wine is really good Daily specials-fish and chips and chicken-yummy Twice baked potatoes very good  Calamari excellent Jello on the salad bar-yes please! Waitress Judy was super friendly even though she was swamped Homemade mud pie from Maria Prime rib tasted awesome Cold plates for salad-super important!! Better next time Moldy cucumbers in the salad bar Prime rib had too much fat-yucky!! Ran out of ribs Overall we had a great experience! It seemed as if most of the people in there were regulars which also made for a fun time. The place seemed very Midwestern to me, almost like a supper club or something like that. I can't wait to go back!

This place rocks...it's simply the best neighborhood bar, with the greatest old timers hanging out there. I always enjoy my food, my drinks and the company - no one drinks alone here.  Where else can you find a salad bar from the 70's still up and functioning with bacon bits...  There is a great burger deal on Tuesdays (I think) and they ahve a neat little patio with a TV.

Oh yeah. Now we are talking.   This place is so old-school every time I go there I feel like I should be driving an Olds Toronado and wearing a Jantzen Shirt-Jac. I want to travel back in time and show up with Angie Dickinson on my arm and smoke a fat cigar in their bar while calling the waitress "sugar". I walk through the front door and suddenly it's 1972.  And yes, these are good things.  The ceilings are low, there are no windows to speak of, and the the brick arches inside recall something like a German rathskeller.  Along with more modern dishes, the menu features old delights like Osso Bucco, Liver and Onions, and Beef Wellington. At the salad bar  you load up your pewter plate with julienned carrots among other things under a generic "Salad Bar" sign that probably came out of a Sysco catalog 30 years ago. Just behind the salad bar is the grill, steaming away under a large copper canopy. Watch and smell those delectable slabs of meat give up their aroma. An offering to the gods of polyester, Johnny Carson, and the man who reads Playboy.  The martinis are adequate, though not killer. Actually they are probably made the same way they were back when the place opened in 1965. It's only recently that "superpremium" ingredients have raised the standard to lofty heights.  On my most recent visit I had the grilled salmon-shrimp special which came with a couple of asparagus spears, a lemony-butter sauce, a few shrimp and steamed veggies for $21. Hey, as much as I fantasize I need to remember it's not 1972 anymore. Thanks to modern technology I know what my arteries look like. Though the flavors were good, I felt that both the salmon and the shrimp were both a little over-cooked. Overcooked shrimp are safe but rather tasteless. The sauce helped compensate, and the overall effect was satisfying.  I looked longingly at my companion's prime rib, which was delivered exactly as ordered: Medium rare. The prime rib is the star of the show in a joint like this.  There are nightly specials during the week that look like good values.  Though I wouldn't change a thing about the decor, they do need to look after bathroom maintenance a bit, and some background music would be nice.  I plan to return regularly to soak in that 70's flavor. I need to find some white shoes and a matching belt.

Excellent Service!!! Excellent Food!!! Great little hide-a-way that's not your typical cookie cutter restaurant. Great salad bar warm bread and very good prices!  The porkchops are some of the best in the city. Great ambience.  The owner Maria does a fantastic job!

I rarely do reviews but I felt like this little gem deserved some recognition! We chose to come in based off the prime rib reviews- it definitely lived up to the hype. It was cooked perfectly and had great flavor. But my favorite part of the meal was meeting the employees. We met three of them- each were personable and took time to ask about and interact with our baby girl. It is obvious that their customers mean a lot to them. They were so warm and welcoming. We will be back!
Had a fun time here at Dottsy's UYE here.  Good cheap beer and burgers, on a Monday, and friendly service.

We showed up after my graduation as a party of 9 at 5:30pm on a Friday night with no reservation. They quickly accommodated us.  Everything we had was excellent. The ribeye was the best I've ever had. The prime rib was delicious. The chicken picatta was good. My son got a kids burger that was great. My daughter got the linguini with marinara and loved it. The twice. Asked potato would have been better with bacon, but were fantastic as served. The salad bar was fresh and the clam chowder decadent.   The menu said they add gratuity to parties of six or more, however they did not add gratuity, so we tipped them even better. This was an exceptional experience. We aren't local but next time we are back in Phoenix will will be back for sure!

Amazing! Service and food were fantastic! Drinks from the bar were made well, Beef Wellington was to die for. My son had the lamb chops - also very good. My other son had a burger that he couldn't finish (very big portion)! We were too full for dessert but I did see a few go by and they looked awesome. Next time I won't stuff the whole Wellington down and I'll save room for dessert! Salad bar is good, there's a nice variety of appetizers and entrees, and even a variety of sides if you're not in the "full dinner" mode. They have specials during the week, too.   I'll definitely hit them up again soon!

It was our first time I loved it. Judy is so nice and funny. Food is delicious. Atmosphere is nice and quiet for early dinner. We got prime rib and it's one of the best one. Salad bar is a nice addition

Brought two newbies with me this time. As always great service coupled with great food. Prime rib was perfect with the baked potato prepared with slight crunch to skin. One diner said best prime rib in the valley. The other dining partner commented that the filet was perfectly cooked and would be back for another visit... Two new patrons .. Thx Feeney's

Great little spot ! I would of never ever thought of walking in here. But the reviews made me want to try it out . Great service as soon as you walk in the door, your greeted walked to a table . Prices are reasonable. I only had appetizers but the where  tasty ! If your near by stop by give it a try .
Really bad truck stop salad bar and the quality of food not good, beef Wellington over cooked meat and doughy pastry

Old school yo!  We're talking salad bar with beets, sunflower seeds and cottage cheese yo!  We're talking prime rib of Flintstonian proportions!   I met a group of good friends here recently. We were seated in a back (non window) room and my claustrophobia almost got the best of me. It was a pretty tiny room. Soon I decided it wasn't tiny. It was cozy. And soon the Coronas were a- comin' and the conversation was flowing.  Our server, a delightful woman, was efficient and friendly. And a shout out to her just for handling a group of a dozen or so yelpers! Can you imagine waiting on us lol!?!?  My prime rib and baked potato were pure perfection. The salad bar was fresh and fully loaded.   Much like myself towards the end of the evening.  The decor is all muraled-out if memory serves me. So there's a lot going on!   So Feeney's you got a new fan! Great place to take my folks, out of towners or anyone I think is worthy of the Feeney charm!!!  Yo!

I have eaten here several times and have had many items on the menu except for the steaks.  I hear the steaks are really good by the way.  I like the old school look to this place.  Feels very comfortable.  There is a nice bar area by the front and a few rooms for dining plus a salad bar that is pretty well stocked.  Service is always good.  I have never had to ask for a server to come by.  This place is always busy for dinner, a couple of times I could not even find parking.  My last visit I was able to park close to the door.  I ate at the bar once at that was nice too.  I had the trout but for some reason it was not as good as other places I've had the trout.  I also had the Osso Bucco, $22.95, and is was pretty good but was missing a little something.  I had broccoli as a side and even though it was bright green, it was somewhat tough.  The Chicken Picatta, $18.95 was kind of a disappointment.  The chicken breast is supposed to be pounded but was not which often makes the breast dry.   It makes such a big difference I don't know why some places are not wiling to pound the breast this as it should be for many of these Italian style chicken.  I would not recommend this dish or the Chicken Marsala because it also should be pounded. (check out any receipe online).   I should probably try the steak because this is a steak place after all.  If you live in the area this place is definitely worth a try.

I always get amazing service here. Staff is so nice and accommodating. They make a special order for me every time and it is the best thing ever considering I'm picky. Definitely one of my favorite restaurants!

Nice quaint little restaurant. Nothing major negative to say but overall it was not what I was hoping for in a quality restaurant. If you are going to price like an upscale steakhouse then you should deliver like an upscale steakhouse. This was really nothing more than a nice neighborhood restaurant. Would not return.
Super cute restaurant with great service. Fun, local atmosphere and family-like staff after just a few visits. Feeney's Steak Salad for life!

A group of three of us went on a Wednesday night for the first time.  I ordered the salisbury steak (one of the Wednesday $10 specials) and it was fantastic.  It was thick and juicy and topped with a wonderful mushroom gravy.  The mashed potatoes were homemade and very, very good.  The meal came with the salad bar which was nicely stocked with fresh items.  It wasn't a large salad bar, but it was perfect for a pre-meal salad.  Our waitress was friendly and attentive.  She had a lovely accent (Russian maybe?) and made sure we never ran out of beer.  Overall, it was a fun experience and we'll definitely be going back.

This neighborhood restaurant/bar is so excitingly unusual in Phoenix. The food is delicious (definitely try the prime rib), andthe service is unrivaled. This is a family-run throwback to pre-chain takeovers. The salad bar is crisp and fresh. The crowd is friendly. Don't miss this place!
The burgers are great. The decor is definitely old school, but the waitstaff are friendly.

A hidden gem situated in Uptown Phoenix, the owners couldn't be any nicer. Great steak house cooking up all your favorites like ribeye, prime rib and fish dishes. When we stop in we're greated by the owner who gives us a big hug, it's like going to Mom's steak house. I've been eating here for years, so it was about time I posted a review. Hope to see you here!!!

My fIrst dining experience at Feeney's. We had lunch. After reading reviews I opted for 8 oz prime rib served with potato or rice side and soup or salad. I chose mashed potatoes with gravy and salad bar.  Salad bar included fresh lettuce beets, garbanzo beans, carrots and cucumbers, black olives, red onion, etc. etc. served on a frozen pewter salad plate. yum!  Homemade coleslaw, potato and macaroni salads too. Salad dressings are all homemade. Blue cheese dressing was so delicious. The prime rib was an excellent piece of meat in every way--flavorful and tender.  The owner Maria, served us and she is extremely cordial. Looking forward to bringing my husband with me next time.

I went here last weekend with the BF's parents to see if we would like to have our rehearsal dinner here. When we first walked in, I wasn't 100% convinced because this place is old school....like what I remember a sizzler or something looking like in the 90's. The place is dark and it has an old school salad bar.... need I say more? But this place really surprised me with their excellent service and food. We started with apps (which is totally unnecessary because the portions here are out of control). We had the spinach dip and the potato skins....it was good, but typical bar food. I also had a couple mimosas because they were on special for 1$....heck yes! We then got our soup/salad bar. I had the soup and it was good, nothing terribly special, but not bad. Then the (humongous) entrees....I had the lamb chops and they were delicious! They were perfectly cooked and seasoned....super juicy, they reminded me of eating lamb chops at home as a kid....definitely delicious. The BF had the new york strip which was equally good. He got it medium well, and they managed to keep it moist and juicy....awesome! We all got twice baked potatoes with our meals, which were very good (how can potato and cheese and bacon and whatnot be bad?). We finished with mud pie, which was ok, but nothing special. Anyway, at the end of the meal (while I was sitting there dying of stuffedosity) the owner came over and spent the time to chat with us about how our party was going to be set up and what the room would look like. I liked how friendly and accommodating the owner was. We are planning to have our rehearsal dinner, so I will update after that! Definitely check this hidden treasure out!

Judy!! Judy! Judy! Ok let me start with I LOVE their salad bar, simple and perfect. Happy hour is great. Their Prime Rib...the best. Honestly it's all great. Judy is the best! Remembers my likes, dislikes and just the nicest person ever. As much as I love the food here, Judy is the driving force for me each week!
Love that is the same, haven't been here in years, excellent. Had the ribeye. This app is pissing me off forcing me to write more than I wanted to

2nd time to Feeney's  fabulous, brought friends for a celebration. Prime rib superb, trout fabulous. Even though its a ride from Scottsdale  definitely worth it.                                 Barbra & Ronnie Gradozzi

We went here for my husband's birthday on a Friday.  Got here around 5:30.  The place wasn't packed and we had a comfortable corner table.  The restaurant is clean and inviting.  We were immediately greeted as we walked in.  If there is one place I have ever reviewed that takes the cake for best service, it's definitely Feeney's!  For starters we had their amazing potato skins.  I could tell just with the appetizer that we were in for a treat with our meal.  The potato skins were meaty and crispy and crunchy and so on point! They were so generous with their sour cream too!   On to the main course!  Two words.  Beef.  Wellington.  Now I'm sure you've heard of Gordon Ramsay and his famous beef Wellington.  I had the opportunity to try Ramsay's version at his Vegas restaurant.  Feeney's version is very comparable in quality and a much, much more economical version.  The beef was so tender and heavenly.  If I had to make just one comment, it would be that the sherry reduction was a tad saltier than it needed to be. However, don't let this deter you from ordering this dish.  The sauce is more of a garnish than a necessity to the dish.  My husband ordered the prime rib.  I would have loved to eat more of his steak too, but I was beyond full by the time     he even thought to offer me any lol!  If you're looking for a low key date night (or any night) check out Feeney's.  Just be prepared to add them to your list of local favorites.

I have never been here before and my wife decided to take me here for my birthday dinner. I have always wanted to try Beef Wellington ever since I seen it cooked on Hells Kitchen.. And they didn't disappoint. The Wellington was cooked perfectly and the sauce was very flavorful. I would definitely come here again for dinner. A +++ service a nice quiet atmosphere on Sunday perfect for a couple having a quiet romantic dinner.

This little gem just got better with the upgrades they have brought Feeney's into this century with class. The food is still very good and done well to each customer's preference. They have some unique items other places do not. It is the best service and we love the owners and staff.

Had fantastic meal here.  The wife and I both ordered the Beef Wellington.  It was outstanding.  The outer pastry was light and flaky and delicious.  The meat was cooked perfectly as well!! Pricey but worth it.  From the outside it is rather nondescript, but the owners and staff were very friendly.  Inside it was nice, good decorum and a large wine list to choose from.  Salad bar was just o.k. Overall I would definitely recommend.

Had dinner last night it was fabulous. The service here is just phenomenal. They came to fill my drink before it was empty SEVERAL times. From the moment we walked in the door it felt like they wanted us to be there. We will be back for sure.   The prime rib was perfect!
Back for meal two...salisbury steak..on special  and really good!!  This place is sooo awesome.  Great ambiance..amazing beer selection and always great and friendly service!! Will be back
I love Feeney's.  The place is the best kept secret in Phoenix.  I'm bringing the family here next time they visit.

best of the best,  a Phoenix landmark, great food, great service, great reasonable house wine, why go anywhere else?  Love the place, warm, comfortable surroundings, like going back to the good all days.  Everyone seems to know you, even if you have not been back for a year..

Great place, very friendly and welcoming, excellent food.  Frankly it is one of my favorite steak houses in town, in part because the quality of the meat is excellent and the price is reasonable.  The decor is rustic and reminds me of the steak houses my dad loved when I was a kid.  You pay for good food and excellent service, not for glitz.  That's just how I like it.

It was clean and quiet and my mother's walleye was very good, my Shepard's pie was alright but my wife's liver and onions was the worse she's ever had.  Also there was no bread or anything and it took probably 20-40 for our meals to arrive and they did no one came to check on us.  Won't be back.

This place encapsulates everything good about grassroots family-owned dinning. Amazing service, awesome food, very cool atmosphere. Total pride and ownership from the family, at point. Prime Rib was thick and plentious, way I like 'em! ;) salad bar was very good. Great experience all around.

Dark lighting and old school charm interior.  Decent food for take out; lacks presentation but again, this was a 'to go' order. We ordered the Beef Wellington which was good. This is not a high-end restaurant so factor that in when giving it a try. Salad bar had many options and salad items were fresh. Staff was nice and our food was ready to go when we arrived.
Delicious food the service is a little slow or they would get 5 stars...but its not stopping me from going back. Its close to my house and well worth the price.
I love this place! This is one of the best steaks I have had in Arizona. Perfectly cooked. I will keep going back here
Great almond trout!  Get family run business feel and vibe.  Awesome place for a group dinner or place to grab a drink.

This place looks like they haven't changed anything since 1955. It's the kind of steakhouse my grandfather would have loved. They do all the classics really really well. The beef wellington is exceptional.

i'm feelin' a feeney. ya know what i mean? prolly not. but thats ok.  Feeney's is just a cool spot on the travels of my life. one of my favorites bartenders from Hanratty's works here now, Whats up Chrystal..we gotta do brunch soon. :)  Feeney's has a bomb patty melt. i love patty melts. greasy, cheesy, burgery and oniony. yep check all four things on the list. definetly something to check out if your in the area. awesomeness lives here. it's pure WIN...trust me.
